She starts her daily work day very early in order to to leave to deliver her product on her rounds of the streets in the afternoons.

The objective of this new loan is to invest in work capital to buy products like sugar, food coloring, coconuts, wrapping paper, cinnamon, firewood, and plastic bags, among others. Ana is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders give to people with scarce financial resources so that they have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like sugar, food coloring, coconuts, wrapping paper, cinnamon, firewood, and plastic bags, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain so as to expand her farming.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a catering services business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ornamental plants business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials, like fertilizers, flower pots, etc. for her business.  Lolita has been in this business for eight years now.

Lolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fertilizers, flower pots, etc. for her business

loans.name: Wilberton

texts.en:
Wilberton, aged 27 years, is married and has one child, aged one year. He is a small-scale farmer where he gets money to feed his family. He has applied for a loan of  Ugx 1,500,000 (One million five hundred thousand shillings) to buy  more stock for his clothes business.  He started his clothes business in the year 2010, with high hopes of earning income to look after his family. 

He also does agriculture where he earns income to supplement on his monthly income. His business is located in Busy Street, Bugongi Sheema District and his clients are all categories of people. He is a hard working man who works 10 hours a day and 6 days a week but is faced with a challenge of high prices for goods.  He has learned to manage it. He is determined to boost his business after getting a loan, and to achieve his long term dream of becoming financially stable and owning a wholesale drug shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives with her large family in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. She is married and she lives with her husband (who is now in the Russian Federation working), two sons, daughter and retired mother-in-law. 

Gohar has a farm she takes care of cows, calves, heifers, sheep and chickens. She sells all her farm products at the city’s wholesale market. Gohar’s elder son greatly helps her in farming work and with his own truck gives cargo services to their neighbors; he transfers hay and also fodder of farm cattle and brings some income to his family’s numerous needs. Gohar is proud of him, who being so young, already greatly lightens her hardships and he is also good example for his smaller brother who is still school-aged. 

Now the truck is out of order and it needs to be urgently repaired, in order not to lose any business. So Gohar wants to help her son with this loan. She needs to repair the truck and also she wants to buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: for repairing the truck of her son and also she wants to buy fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 45 years old.  She is married and has three children. With her children in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, home product care, and other groceries.  Elsa has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Hamidu Village. Samaila joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Samaila suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield . Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Samaila will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Samaila now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toys to start his own business.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 36 years old and she supports a family of six children. She has been in the tea farming business for the last 10 years and the business has been profitable. 

Monicah has applied for her first loan of KES. 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production so as to sell and supply milk.  She hopes this will enable her to make more income and expand her farming. 

She plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and to educate her children. Her future hope is to expand her farming, make more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production so as to sell and supply milk.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 27 years old. He is married with one child. He has had a barber shop business for 10 years. He will be using the loan to purchase more equipment and hopes this will help him pay school fees. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are have many successful business and to be able to pay school fees successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more barber shop equipment to help him pay school fees

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estelita is 58 years old now.

Estelita has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Estelita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Estelita  has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Estelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 40, is a married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For seven years, Gloria has run a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 15,000 PHP loan  through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy additional supplies such as nail polish, nail cutters, nippers, etc. for her business. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her manicure/pedicure business

loans.name: Maria Gloribel

texts.es:
Ana, de 27 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora, logro estudiar séptimo grado, quien de pequeña se ha dedicado a trabajar haciendo petates porque con su madre se dedicaba a la elaboración de petates, fue por eso que ella también aprendió a elaborarlos, en su casa solo vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios como jornal y su hija la cual tiene 6 años de edad y su suegra.

Ana, necesita el crédito para invertir en el comercio de crianza y venta de cerdo, además desea comprar materiales para la elaboración de petates, un corral para encerrar los cerdo y comprar alimentación para los animales,.

Su mayor sueño es, tener una crianza de cerdos tecnificada y comercializar en grande y con las ganancias ahorrar un poco para hacer su casa, porque actualmente está alquilando.
texts.en:
Ana, age 27, is a very tenacious person. She managed to go to school through the seventh grade. Ever since she was little she has devoted herself to working by making bedrolls because her mother made bedrolls. That is why she also learned to make them.

She lives at her house with her husband, who is a day worker, her six year old daughter, and her mother-in-law.

Ana needs the loan to invest in the trade of raising and selling pigs. She also wishes to buy materials to make bedrolls, to build a pen in which to keep the pigs, and to buy feed for the animals.

Her biggest dream is to have a well-developed business of raising pigs and to have great sales. With the earnings she will build a house because she is currently renting.

loans.use: to invest in the trade of raising and selling pigs, to buy material to make bedrolls, to build a pen for the pigs, and to buy feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stationary to expand his own business

loans.name: Ghaniya

texts.en:
Ghania is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, who are attending school. Her husband is the main income source in the family.  He is a retired from the Lebanese army and he works in the agriculture field with the aim to fulfill the family needs and lifestyle. 

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her children’s educational fees what makes her very happy and optimistic and willing to  always take Kiva loans to continue paying the fees.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 15 años a la pesca artesanal, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de redes, trasmallos y darle mantenimiento al motor de la lancha que es la que muestra en la fotografía para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young lady shown above has had her face pixelated because she is 27 and lives in a high risk area. For 15 years she has been making a living from small-scale fishing. She sells her products in the various markets that are close to her home. She lives in her own house with her husband and daughter.

She is asking for this loan to buy nets and trammel nets and to carry out maintenance work on the engine of her boat, which is pictured above. This will allow her to make more income.

loans.use: to buy nets and trammel nets and to carry out maintenance work on her boat's engine

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 21 años de edad,soltero, en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Julio se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 2 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Julio espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is twenty-one years old, single, and lives in the Cayalti district, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast. It is a peaceful community, the residents mainly work in commercial businesses and raising small animals. 
Julio provides transportation for passengers in his vehicle (mototaxi); he began this work over two years ago. He has experience in this field, and has excellent personal and professional references from the area. The loan will be used to perform repairs and maintenance on his vehicle, since right now it is in poor condition. Julio hopes to offer his customers better service, which will allow him to generate more income and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to perform repairs and maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly con una sonrisa en sus labios afirma ser una comerciante de toda la vida; siempre le gusto la actividad comercial porque sus padres fueron trabajadores independientes y ella aprendió mucho de ellos.  Realizó multiplex cursos de emprendimiento que le permitieron afianzar conocimientos y ayudar a forjar su negocio de venta de mercancías varias, en el cual cuenta con 20 años de funcionamiento y una amplia clientela.  Ella oferta quincenalmente a sus amigos, conocidos y referidos artículos para el cuidado personal, utensilios de cocina y demás, sus compras las realiza a empresas especializadas, sin embargo su capital no abastece la demanda y no puede responder a su clientela al 100%.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en más surtido y así poder responder oportunamente a sus clientes.  Su meta a largo plazo es tener un local y tener una microempresa familiar.
texts.en: With a smile on her face, Nelly affirms she has been a saleswoman all her life; she has always liked sales because her parents were self-employed and she learned a great deal from them. She took many training courses that enriched her knowledge and helped her to build her sales business selling a variety of merchandise, which she has been running for twenty years with a wide customer base. Twice a month, she offers her friends, acquaintances and referred customers personal care articles, kitchen utensils and more. She buys her merchandise from specialty shops, but she doesn't have enough capital to meet the demand and cannot respond to her customers 100%. Now she is applying for her first kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in more stock and be able to better respond to her customers. Her long-term goal is to open a store and have a small family business.

loans.use: invest in more stock to be able to better serve her customers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 60 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Lourdes has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en: As a widowed parent of five children, Flaviana works hard to support her family. She has a door mat vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Flaviana is borrowing 6000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more door mats to sell. Flaviana has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more door mats to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites,43, is married with three children, one of whom is in school. For three years, Marites has raised livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 29,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Marites has borrowed three times from NWTF to sustain her business. Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Savelina

texts.en:
Saverino, aged 49 years, is married. His four children are aged 18, 16, 14 and 12 years. He does coffee trading as his major source of income. He has applied for a loan of UGX4,000,000 (four million shillings) to buy mulches and coffee for sale.  He started business in the year 1988 with high hopes of advancing from subsistence to commercial agriculture and generate income. He also raises cattle to supplement his monthly income. 

His business is located in his local area of residence, Nyanga  Bushenyi District, and his clients are coffee factories in Bushenyi. He is a hard working man who works 10 hours a day and is faced with a challenge of price fluctuation but is determined to grow his business through his hard work. He hopes to become financially stable and become the leading producer of coffee in Bushenyi district and own a personal factory processing coffee.

loans.use: To buy  mulches

loans.name: Crusade 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of five women who are into plastic, products, drinks, plantain, local dishes and frozen food. They have a good connection among the group members. They have lived in the same neighborhood for decades and share a lot of thoughts in common. Their primary activity is small business.

Patience is 46 years old and is the group’s star borrower. She is single and a mother. She own a cold store where she sells frozen fish, chicken, mutton, pork etc. She buys her merchandise in Accra from wholesale prices. She is successful in her business.

With her new loan, she will buy frozen fish, chicken, mutton, pork etc. for GHS 2,000 to stock her cold store. She will sell at retail prices.

This income will allow her to help invest back into her businesses and take care of her child.

loans.use: To buy frozen fish, chicken, mutton, pork etc. to stock her cold store.

loans.name: Naboth

texts.en:
Naboth aged 53 years is married with 8 children where 4 attend school at the moment. He is a farmer but also does cattle trading as his major source of income. 

He has applied for a loan of ugx3,000,000  to buy cattle for trading.  He started business in the year 1993 with high hopes of earning income to cater for his family needs. He also does agriculture where he earns income to supplement his monthly income. 

His business is located in his local cell of residence Kakanju, Bushenyi district and his clients are all categories of people. He is a hard working man who works 8 hours a day and is faced with a challenge of increasing costs of living, but is determined to grow his business through his hard work. He hopes to become financially stable and be the leading trader of cows in Bushenyi.

loans.use: To buy cattle for trade

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 53 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and six children, two of them are still attending school. Her husband is the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life and until now he earns a barely fair income. 

For that reason, today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register her children with the coming school year what makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: William Alfredo

texts.es: William de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace 3 años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mariscos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
William is 38 and lives in his own house with his family unit. He has been making a living selling seafood for three years. He sells door-to-door in the various settlements that are near to his house. With the sales that he makes he is able to cover some of the household costs.

He is asking for a loan to buy more seafood at wholesale so that he can make more income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more seafood at wholesale

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 13 y 16 años de edad. Ella posee una venta de ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, de todo tipo y variedad, blusas, calcetines, ropa interior y artículos como carteras y otros accesorios, tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad a precios bajos y siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan, Ana es una mujer emprendedora que siempre está dispuesta a trabajar duro para alanzar sus objetivos, su secreto para llegar al éxito es la perseverancia y el entusiasmo por lo que siempre está dispuesta a hacer crecer el negocio es por eso que le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, pantalones, trajes, calcetines, carteras entre  otro tipo de vestuario para de esta manera aumentar sus ventas y seguir cumpliendo con los requerimientos de productos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana, age 33, lives in her own home with her life partner and their two children, 13 and 16 years old. She runs a business selling all types and kinds of clothing for women, men, boys, and girls. Her inventory includes blouses, socks, undergarments, accessories such as billfolds, and more. She has a large customer base thanks to her high quality and low prices; plus, she always has what people need. Ana is an enterprising woman who is always ready to work hard to reach her objectives. Her secret to success is perseverance and enthusiasm, and she will do whatever it takes to grow her business. 

That's why she came to FUSAI for this loan, which she will use to buy clothing such as blouses, pants, suits, socks, wallets, and every other sort of clothing. In doing so, she can expand her sales and continue to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: purchase clothing and expand her sales

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 44-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband, and five children, four of them are still studying. Due to the bad financial conditions, she cooperates with her husband to help her family to meet the need of life. She is a hard worker person.  

She opened a clothing shop in her town four years ago, where she offers a great variety of women and kids clothes at good prices. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations to be able to increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 25 years old, married and supports a family of 1 child. He has been operating in motorcycle for the last 8 years earning KES20,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production for the family and to supply in the area for more income gain. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production for the family and to supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is aged 37 years, married to Joseph, and she supports one child.  She has been selling construction materials such as stones, for the last four years, and the business earns her KES 6,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase hammers, and jembes for digging more stones for sale to clients.  She wants to meet both client and family needs. 

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her child.  Her hope is to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase hammers, and jembes for digging more stones for sale to clients

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
VIOLETA TIENE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE CON SU CONYUGE E HIJOS, EN CASA FAMILIAR, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

VIOLETA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE PREPARCION Y VENTA DE MENUS, DESDE HACE MÁS DE 4 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD EN EL NEGOCIO, EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO, Y GOZA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MESAS Y SILLAS PARA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO. DE ESTA MANERA OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Violeta is forty-one years old, she lives with her husband and children in their family home, in a large community in the urban area of Cayalti, in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. 

Violeta prepares and sells meals; she has run this business out of her own home for over four years, and has excellent personal and professional references from her neighbors. She is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to expand her business, and in this way generate higher earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for sell in the market.

loans.name: Analiezl

texts.en:
Analiezl works hard to support her family. Analiezl is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Analiezl requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

Analiezl has been in this business for 5 years now.

Analiezl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married woman, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Leah is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 54 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 63 years old and married with six children.  

Loreta is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Loreta requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Loreta has been raising livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Loreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 30 years old and married.  She has two children. With the children in school, Russel works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10.000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like beers, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, candies, etc. to sell.

Russel has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as beers, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, candies, etc. 

In the future, Russel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like beers, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Liza is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Liza has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 33 years old and has three children. Margarita is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Margarita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Margarita has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ruth is 29 years old and two of her children are in school.

Ruth has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as pants, shirts, etc.

Ruth has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as pants, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy soaps, milk, sandals, rice, oil for resale

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy aged 51 years is married with 5 children aged 20,18,16, 14 and 12 years where 1 attends school at the moment. She has applied for a loan of ugx.1,500,000 to buy firewood for her brick making business.  She does bricklaying as her major source of income which she started in the year 2007 with high hopes of earning income to look after her family. This is because bricks have high demand from the people that are doing house construction. She also does agriculture where she earns income to supplement on her monthly income. 

Her business is located in Katookye and her clients are people in Bushenyi district. She is a hard working woman who works 8 hours a day and 6 days a week but is faced with a challenge of heavy rains and high costs incurred in business, but is determined to excel in business through hard work. She hopes to boost her business after getting a loan.

loans.use: To buy firewood for making bricks

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por cuatro personas, el trabaja en una empresa privada dedicada a la elaboración y distribuidora de pan y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, Andrés quiere mejorar su vivienda derribando y reconstruyendo una pared de la casa la cual por la parte interior se encuentra en pésimas condiciones debido al paso del tiempo y debido a eso teme que pueda ocurrir una desgracia y debido a que con lo que le pagan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito a FUSAI  y poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro, pago de mano de obra, etc. y así poder construir dicha pared que le permita tener junto con su familia una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
Andrés is 27 years old and lives in his family home with four other people. 

Andrés works in a business making and selling bread and makes enough money to support himself. He wants to knock over and rebuild a wall in his home which is in very bad condition and has gotten worse over time. The concern is it could fall over and cause an accident. 

Due to the fact that Andrés doesn't make enough money to pay for these repairs, he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to be able to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron and to pay for labour costs in order to rebuild a wall of the house.  

This will allow Andrés to share a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron and to pay for labour costs in order to rebuild a wall of the house.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 56 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children, some of them are still attending school. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time, as per her husband, who is a farmer. 

Today, given that her children will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the school fees. The parents’ only wish is to provide their children with a respectable educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 58 years old, married to Francisca and supports a family of 8 children. He has been a dairy farmer for the last 4 years and he makes an income of KES 8,000 per month from the sell of milk.

Francis has applied for his first loan of KES. 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for more milk production so as to get milk for sell in the area and make more income to support his family.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to improve his dairy farming and also educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to improve his farming, make more income and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for more milk production so as to get milk for sell in the area and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joy is 32 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Joy has a selling ornamental plants business in the Philippines. Joy requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Joy has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her ornamental plants business

loans.name: Ady

texts.en:
Ady works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ady has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and items to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 4 years now and earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She would like to continue to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 57 years old and married with four children. Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Lucia has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a welding shop business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like welding rods, steel bar, etc. for her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like welding rods, steel bar, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.

Ailyn has a buy-and-sell beverage business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more beverages to sell such as coconut wine, etc.

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to sell such as coconut wine, etc.

loans.name: Zoila Fanny

texts.es: Fanny es una señora alegre con su negocio y muy responsable en sus pagos, Fanny tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella juntamente con su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería, Fanny comenta que empezó con la actividad de ganado desde que VisionFund le otorgo el primer credito, este nuevo credito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su negocio, comenta que su rutina diaria es de levantar a las 4 de la mañana para ordeñar sus vacas y despues vender la leche, Fanny aspira seguir adelante con su negocio y darle la educación a su hija de 17 años y apoyar a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Fanny is a woman who is happy with her business and is very reliable with her repayments. She is 56, is married and has three children. Her and her husband make a living from agriculture and livestock farming. She started the business when VisionFund gave her her first loan. 

She will use this new loan to buy a cow in order to improve her business. Her daily routine is to get up at four in the morning to milk the cows and then sell the milk. 

Fanny's aspirations are to continue with her business, give her 17-year-old daughter an education and support her two sons.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is a 44-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Edita has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Edita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
With capital of GHS 2,200, Yaa will buy more bags of charcoal to sell to customers. At the start, it wasn't easy for her because she had to sell in a small space to win clients. Nevertheless, with effort and perseverance, she was able to get herself a big space where she finds herself in more active commercial area to be able to generate more income.

Because of this, she is asking for a loan to buy more bags of charcoal which she will sell to her customers. This will help her as she will be able to increase her income by offering good service to her customers. She plans to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 30 years old and she supports a family of 6 children. She has been in tea farming business for the last 10 years and it has been profitable.

Josephine has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production to get more milk to sell and to make more income to expand her farming.

She plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to improve her farming, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to get more milk to sell and to make more income to expand her farming.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 33 years old; she is married with two children.

Rosalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Rosalina has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosalina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Elena works hard to support her family. She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Elena is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 41-year-old  married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marivic has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth, bags, and ladies' and gent's wear for resale

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol  is 46 years old, is divorced and she takes care of her 4 daughters.  Marisol pays rent where she is assisted by her ex husband but he only pays the food and the school.

Marisol needs a loan to pay dental treatment for her daughters, so she hopes you can help her.   Marisol is fine and the dentist made a good job on her and now she needs to take care of her daughters health.   Marisol is still working as a secretary

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment for her daughters

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support her family. Angela is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Angela has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dreid fish to sell

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.en:
Bernabe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Bernabe has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, meat, seasonings, fish, etc. for her food production business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Bernabe would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, meat, seasonings, fish, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is a hardworking lady aged 28 years old and a resident of Rwampara mbarara, with 2 children. She is a single mother and a hardworking lady who owns a salon in Mbarara town. She also has a banana plantation where she wants to invest the loan she is looking for. This will help to increase her yields and income. All her children are in good schools and she is a developmental lady who believes her life will be better if she develops her plantation, because of such a family and responsibilities. 

 So she wants ugx5000,000 for buying manure and other mulches to increase output from her plantation and her dream is to yield more matooke from her plantations, afford to pay school fees for her children and improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy organic manure and mulches

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soy souce, cooking oil, shampoo, etc. She has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soy souce, cooking oil, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Iryn

texts.en:
Iryn is 40 years old and married with three children who are in school. Iryn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, milk, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Iryn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, milk, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Zoila Amparo

texts.es: Amparo reside en una Provincia que se caracteriza por ser productiva y ganadera, Amparo se dedica a la crianza de animales, Amparo vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 3, 8, 10 y 12 años, los 3 mayores estan estudiando, Amparo se dedica desde hace 3 años atrás a la crianza de chanchos así el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de dichos animales, su esposo se dedica al jornal de trabajo en el campo, Amparo espera seguir ayudando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y así que sus hijos tenga lo necesario para seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Amparo lives with her husband and their four children in a province that is notable for its fertility and its ranching industry. Their children are 3, 8, 10, and 12 years old, and the oldest three are in school. Amparo herself is in the business of raising animals; she began to raise pigs three years ago. She will use this loan to purchase more animals so that she can support her husband, who works as a farm laborer, with the household expenses. They want to ensure that the children have what they need to stay in school.

loans.use: buy and raise pigs to keep her children in school

loans.name: Nyomo Baafe 2 Group

texts.en:
The group of women are part of Nyomo baafe 2 and are into soft drinks, grocery and eggs. The group comprises of women who are enthusiastic, collaborative and have ample expectations for their families and businesses. Each member has a different and unique business such as: soft drinks, grocery and eggs

In the case of Elizabeth, a working woman, in her 45th year, she has been a fundamental pillar in her household by sharing the costs of expenses and supporting the education and sustainability of her family. Since she herself did not get the opportunity to go to school, Elizabeth is constantly motivating and supporting her children to continue and complete their formal education.  Elizabeth brings income to the household by owning and running an egg business, with the loan she hopes to receive, Elizabeth hopes to reinvest into her business by purchasing more crates of eggs for her business which she will sell to customers.

For these women it is their very fifth time asking for a loan from Kiva and they feel privileged that they are receiving the support of investors from all around the world.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs for her business which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Mubende Light School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Chris. He is the Head Teacher of Mubende Light School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mubende with 700 students. 

Mubende Light School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. 

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mubende Light School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Chris ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, 40, is a beverage dealer from Buhangin Proper, Davao City. She is married to Marcial and they have children. 

As a soft drinks or beverage dealer, Rosalie buys loads of bottled drinks at wholesale prices and then resells them by the case or by the bottle. She distributes cases of drinks to sari-sari stores. She has been doing this for five years and it has provided well for her family's everyday needs.

However, the problem in this kind of business is the risk of bottle breakage, as this consumes a big portion of capital. In addition to this, the unreturned bottles which are considered lost also deplete her capital. 

The good thing about Rosalie is that she knows how to manage her everyday budget. She still dreams of improving her yard to use as her own outlet or stockroom. She feels that this dream is coming closer to reality, especially if she can avail herself of a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy additional cases of soft drinks and energy drinks. 

She really hopes you can extend your heartfelt generosity to her. 

Rosalie would be happy to see all her children finish their college education and land more stable jobs. She is a compliant member of the CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional cases of soft drinks and energy drinks

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy  is a hard working lady from Nyamitanga, Mbarara district.  She is an educated lady and an appropriator of Joline Stars Nursery and Day Care  This lady fulfilled her dream of putting a pre-school as one way of employing other people.  She has been a client and the purpose of this money is to buy more scholastic material for her school.

She has applied for a loan of ugx5,000,000 as she has high hopes of expanding her school to a higher level and better standard. She needs to expand her land to build more rooms for her school but is limited by capital. She is confident that a continuous financial boost will help her to increase the capacity of her school.

She also appreciates the friendly repayment plan by UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy scholastic materials

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley comes from a remote village found in the Bomet area of Kenya. He practices dairy and poultry farming to make a living and uses most of his income to meet his family’s basic needs. Stanley is married and has 1 child. He is determined to grow his business and improve his family’s income. 

Stanley is seeking a loan to buy poultry to produce eggs, chicks, and meat for consumption and sale. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken because they are well-adapted to local conditions. With your loan investment into his business, Stanley will make the best out of the increased demand for poultry products in the market. This economic opportunity once seized will improve his livelihood and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy poultry to improve his income

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
The photo above shows Fidela selling cooked food with a self-prepared beverage in front of her house in Buhangin Proper, Davao City. 

Fidela embarked on this business as an additional income-generating venture for her family, and through it she maximizes her cooking talent and the limited space in front of their house. She displays her cooked food, packed into servings for sale. This is more practical for her as she doesn’t need to maintain a big space for customers to eat, and she has no need for lots of eating utensils and equipment, and no need for dishwashers or food servers. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors, the local community, students and working people. The profit derived from her business is quite limited due to her limited capital. She yearns to cook more meal recipes to boost her sales and income. She prays for this PHP 12,000 supplementary capital which she will use to buy additional quantities of meat, fish, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. 

Her profit combined with her husband’s income will help with their daily expenditures, monthly utility bills, and their children’s educational expenses. The couple aspires to give their children education, as this is the most precious inheritance for them. Fidela also prays for good health and long life for her whole family. She is an inspiration to her co-fellowship* members at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect on God’s Words and share stories about life and their businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional quantities of meat, fish, vegetables, condiments and seasonings

loans.name: Anina

texts.en:
Anina live in Atsabe, she was married and she has 2 children. She has a kiosk in her house and she also selling in the market. She is requesting a loan of $ 1.000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. 

She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as perfumes, children's toys, hair band and other things to sell. Anina started to open her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $ 300.00. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, children's toys, hair band and other things to sell.

loans.name: Maria Lindaura

texts.es:
Maria tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Maria se dedica a la crianza y venta de carneros, chivos, chivatos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de chivos, borregos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto María espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, age 51, lives with her partner in a rural area in the district of Cayaltí, which is part of Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region, along the northern coast of Peru. Most of the people in the area are farmers, ranchers, or tradespeople.

Maria is in the business of raising and selling rams, lambs, and billy goats. With fifteen years of experience, she runs her business out of her home, and has very good personal and professional references from other people in the area.  

This loan will help her to buy a number of kid goats and lambs, among other animals, as well as nutritionally balanced feed for them. With this, Maria hopes to offer her customers a better product, earn more income, and ultimately improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy kid goats, lambs, and nutritious feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair and maintain his motorbike taxi

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano es un hombre de 48 años de edad, es casado vive junto a su linda familia en una comunidad de Sololá. Mariano es un padre de familia que prioriza la comodidad de su familia, él trabaja como agricultor y hace algún tiempo tuvo la oportunidad de tener acceso a un crédito en ADICLA y que gracias a ello pudo comprar sus semillas e insumos agrícolas para su cultivo, a Dios gracias le fue muy bien porque obtuvo muy buena cosecha, Mariano es un hombre que busca la superación con esfuerzo y lucha, el ahora nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un crédito que lo invertirá esta vez en la compra semillas de papa y fertilizantes; Mariano guarda las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el crédito para el bienestar de su cultivo y también de su familia, porque con esta cosecha el espera obtener mejores ganancias, de igual manera espera ser contactado por una empresa que lo ayude a exportar  sus verduras en otros países.
texts.en:
Mariano, age 48, is married and lives with his lovely family in the community of Sololá. In Mariano's family, family always comes first. He works as a farmer, and some time ago he had the chance to access some credit through ADICLA. Thanks to the loan, he was able to buy seeds and farming supplies to plant his crop, and thanks to God, it was a good harvest.

Mariano is the kind of man who seeks to improve his situation through hard work and struggle, and today, he needs another loan to invest in this business. He will purchase seed potatoes and fertilizers. Mariano hopes to obtain this loan for the well being not only of his crops, but also of his family; with a good harvest, he will achieve even greater earnings. He similarly expects to be contacted by a business that will help him to sell his vegetables abroad.

loans.use: buy seed potatoes and fertilizer

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.ru:
Зиеда жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем  и имеет двоих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Зиеда живёт в небольшом селе. Она очень любит свою семью. Для того, чтобы обеспечивать свою семью Зиеда  работает швеёй.
Сейчас Зиёда имеет нужду. У них в доме не имеется холодильника, совсем недавно их старый холодильник сломался и не подлежит ремонту. Но сейчас в жаркое время без холодильника невозможно. А у Зиёды сейчас нет необходимой суммы денег для покупки холодильника. Поэтому сейчас Зиёда обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку холодильника. Она очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Ziyoda is a hardworking woman with a positive attitude in life. She is 28, married, and the mother of two children. She deeply loves her family and lives with them in a small village. In order to support her family, she works as a seamstress. 

Ziyoda currently needs help: her family doesn't have a refrigerator at the moment, since their old fridge just broke down and is beyond repair. As it is impossible to live without a fridge in the summer, Ziyoda needs money to buy a new refrigerator. For this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand and requested a loan. She is looking forward to a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy a refregirator

loans.name: Grupo Chavoc Group

texts.es:
Maria es una gran mujer de 53 años, casada con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 28 y 33 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá. Maria (la primera del lado derecho) es una de las mujeres que se esfuerza mucho para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ella desde hace 10 años es comerciante en el piso plazo de su comunidad; Maria también se dedica a oficios domésticos en varias casas de su comunidad, con estas dos actividades aporta a los gastos.
Maria su amabilidad, carisma y sinceridad son las cualidades que la caracterizan en su comunidad, es por ello que tiene muchos clientes y se ha dado cuenta que su producto ya no se da abasto, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para comprar artículos de bisutería para elaborar artículos artesanales y satisface mejor los gustos de la gente.
El gran sueño de Maria es lograr comprar más terreno para que sus hijos cuenten con terreno donde puedan construir.
texts.en:
Maria is a wonderful woman, fifty-three years old, married with a beautiful family of three children aged between twenty-eight and thirty-three years old. This humble family lives in a community of Solola. Maria (on the far right) is a woman who works hard to support her husband in covering the household expenses; for ten years she has been a seller in their community's market; Maria also does domestic work in various homes in her community; with these two jobs she helps cover their expenses. 
Maria is known in her community for her warmth, charisma and sincerity, that's why she has so many customers, and she has noticed that she doesn't have enough products to meet the demand, so she is requesting a loan to buy jewelry-making supplies to use to make artisanal wares and better satisfy the public's tastes. 
Maria's dream is to be able to purchase more land so that her children will have land where they can build.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making jewelry

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 51 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia  con el que vive muy feliz mente, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juan para salir adelante con su familia es tejedor pero también se dedica a la compra de cebolla por cuerda, su familia vive de los  ingresos que obtiene de estas dos actividades, Juan cuenta que con el crédito anterior le fue muy bien porque pudo satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y a Dios gracias le dejo muy buena ganancia. Pero Juan es un hombre que busca prosperarse y es por ello que solicita un  nuevo préstamo para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo para la compra de cebollas por cuerda. Juan tiene el anhelo de conseguir el crédito lo más pronto posible para que su negocio de cebolla sea lo más rentable, también sueña en finalizar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Juan is  a 51-year-old man who is married and has a lovely family with whom he lives very happily. They reside in a community in Solola. To get ahead with his family Juan works as a tailor and, in addition, he also buys onions by the bundle to sell. His family survives on the incomes he obtains from these two activities.

Juan tells us that all went very well with the previous loan, since he was able to satisfy his customers' needs and, thanks to God, he made very good earnings.

Since Juan is a man who wishes to prosper, for that reason, he is requesting a new loan to serve as working capital for the purchase of more onions by the bundle to sell.

Juan hopes to obtain the loan as soon as possible so that his onion business may be more profitable. Also, he dreams of finalizing the construction of his house.

loans.use: to purchase onions by the bundle to sell.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом уроженец города Курган-Тюбе. Ему 36 лет, женат и у него четыре очаровательных детей. Илхом шустрый и общительный парень. Он продает детскую одежду. Этим бизнесом он занимается уже более 18 лет. Его жена домохозяйка. Илхому помогают его мама и его братья. Он очень старается ради будущего своих детей. Он желает, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование стали интеллигентными людьми. Ему сейчас нужно закупить новую партию одежды, но для этого ему необходимыми денежные средства, которых у него недостаточны. С этой целью Илхом обратился за кредитом. Он надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Ilhom was born in Qurgan-Tube. He is 36 years old, married and has four lovely children. He is an energetic and outgoing person. Ilhom sells children’s clothing. He has been in this business for over 18 years. His wife is a homemaker. Ilhom’s mother and brother help him in the business. Ilhom works very hard for the sake of his children’s future. He would like his children to go to college and become well-educated. 

At present Ilhom needs to buy a new batch of clothing, but his financial means are insufficient. This is why he has applied for a loan. He is hoping for your help.

loans.use: to purchase children`s clothes

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 41 años de edad, soltera , sin hijos a su cargo , vive en casa propia; en el distrito de Cayaltí la cual es una zona rural, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, Costa norte de Perú.

Norma se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria; hace 2 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, con muy buenas referencias laborales y personales. Solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de una mochila para fumigar; esto le servira para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia, para poder brindar mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Norma is forty-one years old, single, without any children under her care. She lives in her own home, in the Cayalti district which is a rural area in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. 

Norma has worked as a day laborer for the past two years, a business she runs out of her home. She has very good personal and professional references. She is requesting a loan to invest in a fixed asset, to buy pesticide equipment; this will allow her to keep her tools in better condition and have a better appearance, to provide better services.

loans.use: to buy a pesticide sprayer

loans.name: Reyes Roberto

texts.es:
La cosas no vienen por si solas si no uno mismo tiene que salir a buscarlos, es lo  que Reyes ha hecho por 15 años, han sido años de mucho esfuerzo y de lucha, él tiene 41 años, tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos que son su razón de vida, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá. El para brindarle a su familia todo lo necesario se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción, gracias a sacado adelante a su familia, pero para obtener otro ingreso presta servicio de trasporte.
Reyes desde muy joven se a sacrificado para tener su negocio, el desde hace mucho tiempo ha tenido el anhelo de poder comprar una camioneta familiar para tener como movilizarse con su familia, pues ellos viven en una zona muy lejana por lo que este es su mayor necesidad, Reyes a pesar de que se ha esmerado mucho para poder realizar este sueño realidad no le ha sido posible, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de esta camioneta. Reyes con las ganancias que genera de su negocio estará abonando una parte para su crédito y la otra parte para los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Things don't happen by themselves, you have to go out and find them. This is what Reyes has done for 15 years. They have been years of great effort and struggle. He is 41 years old and has a beautiful family of 4 children who are his reason for living. They live in a community of Sololá. In order to provide his family with everything they need he works buying and selling construction materials. Thanks to this he can get his family ahead but he also has another income which is providing transportation services.

Since he was quite young Reyes has sacrificed to have his business. He has had the desire to be able to buy a family sized truck to have to get around with his family as they live in an isolated area. This is his greatest need. Reyes in spite of having taken much care to make this dream come true has not been able to do it and for this reason is requesting a loan to buy his truck. Reyes is using the money he generates from his business partially for his loan and the rest for the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy a small truck for his personal use.

loans.name: Los Artesanos Del Sector Tecum Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer soltera de 48 años de edad, ella vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juana (es la primera del lado derecho en la foto) es una mujer que lucha cada día para apoyar a su familia, pues desde hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, le gusta hacer esta actividad ya que lo hace desde la comunidad de su hogar, y esto le permite también realizar los oficios de su casa, con esta actividad ella contribuye con su familia en los gastos.
 Juana con el afán de seguir elaborando ropa típica, ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en su tejido con este dinero ella estará comprado hilos de tipo, seda, alemán, y lustrina, y todo lo relacionado con la línea de tejido, Juana tiene el sueño de instalar un local donde ella pueda vender su propio producto.
texts.en:
.Juana is a single woman, 48 years old, who lives with her family in a community in Solola.

Juana (she is 1st on the right in the photo) is a woman who struggles each day to help her family. Since she was 15 years old, she has been dedicated to elaborating typical clothing. She enjoy this activity and is able to do it in her home in the community. This allows her to perform household chores as well. With this activity, Juana is able to help covering family expenses.

With the intention of elaborating additional typical clothing, Juana is requesting a loan to invest in her sewing business. With this money she will purchase thread of the following types: silk, German, and lustring, and buy other necessary things related to her sewing. 

Juana dreams of some day installing a shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy thread for use in making traditional clothing.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Ambrose, a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Siongiroi area of Kenya. Ambrose relies on livestock and crop farming to produce food and generate income for his family.  His future plans are dependent on the growth of his agri-business and that is why he joined a solidarity group called 'Sunrise Atembwo' to secure financial services. 
Ambrose is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will increase the number of livestock on his farm and the quantity of milk that he supplies. However, the impact of your loan goes beyond direct food production to include multipurpose uses, such as skins, fiber, fertilizer and fuel, as well as capital accumulation. 
Increased income generated from this loan investment will help Ambrose pay for his family’s basic needs as well as buy agricultural supplies, such as seed, fertilizers, pesticides, animal feed, and implements to ensure sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy and sell chickens.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and married. He works on a 0.5 acre farm in Central Kenya where he lives with his wife and 3 children. John makes a living practicing poultry and pig farming. He is seeking a loan to buy poultry. 
With a loan of KES 20,000, John will buy almost 40 heads of poultry. Eggs and other products from these hens will create a significant increase in John's revenue and income. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken that are adapted to local conditions. 
John will use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s well-being and pay for his children’s education. He also wants to continue investing in poultry to make it bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Livingstone, a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Siongiroi area of Kenya. Livingstone relies on livestock and crop farming to produce food and generate income. His future plans are dependent on the success of his dairy farm and that is why he joined a solidarity group called ‘Tuyo’ in order to secure financial services. 
Livingstone is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will increase the number of livestock on his farm and the quantity of milk that he supplies. However, the impact of your loan goes beyond direct food production to include multipurpose uses, such as skins, fibre, fertilizer and fuel, as well as capital accumulation. 
Increased income generated from this loan investment will help Livingstone pay for his family’s basic needs as well as buy agricultural supplies, such as seed, fertilizers, pesticides, animal feeds, and implements to ensure sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Porvenir está en su ciclo número 3, ellas son de la ciudad de Concepción, una zona rural que aún está en crecimiento y donde las integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales y se esfuerzan por poder crecer.
La Sra. Perla es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro de la ciudad donde sale a vender sus productos de limpieza que ella misma prepara con los insumos que la fundación paraguaya ofrece por medio de sus microfranquicias para hacer productos de limpieza.  Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de microfranquicias de limpiezas para poder hacer productos de limpiezas para la venta y  de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group named Porvenir is in its third cycle. The women are from the city of Concepción, in a rural area which is growing and where the members make a living in rural activities and and strive to grow.

Perla is one of the members. She is from a remote area in the center of the city where she sells her cleaning products that she has prepared herself with supplies that Fundación Paraguaya offers through its micro-franchises to make products for cleaning. She is a hardworking person and a fighter.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cleaning micro-franchises to be able to make cleaning products for sale. In this way she is able to continue growing with her business and give her family what they need to have a life without hardship.

loans.use: to buy cleaning product micro-franchises for the manufacture of cleaning products for sale.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
You will be pleased to know Arlyn, 47 years old and married with children. Two of her children are studying in college. They live in Davao City in the Mindanao region. Arlyn has been raising hogs in her backyard for seven years now. Hog raising, according to her is quite tiring but she focuses on its sustainability and its contribution to food production for the community. It also provides for their everyday expenses and some savings for the future. 

A few days ago, the sow or mother pig gave birth to several piglets. These piglets will soon be weaned from the mother, meaning Arlyn will need additional sacks of feeds for them. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan for this purpose. In the next few months, these piglets will give higher return for her investment and she can supply more consumers in their community. If her hog raising business improves steadily, it will be easier for her to support her children’s college expenses. 
	
She shares her aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT. She has been a dedicated member of the organization for almost twelve years; she continually gains inspiration from Bible reflections and sharing of life experiences. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of hog feeds.

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
Tirso owns and operates a sari-sari store (convenience store) in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte in the Philippines. He is 65 years old, married, and he has adult children. 

Tirso signed up for membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in order to access the financial assistance it offers to small time borrowers like him. He is thankful to the cooperatve because it is always there for his financial needs. 

Recently, Tirso requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to both purchase bags of cement and pay for the labor to repair his house. 

Tirso hopes to live in a comfortable and decent home with his family.

loans.use: to both purchase bags of cement and pay for the labor to repair his house.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella is 51 years old, and she is married with 3 children.

Annabella works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Annabella has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 3 years, and she also earns an income from rice retailing.

Annabella aspires to save enough money to both expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es:
Bartolo es un hombre de 41 años de edad, es casado tiene una familia de dos hijos de la edades entre 6 y 8 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Bartolo para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  al agricultura, esta actividad lo aprendió el de su papa y ahora ya tiene 10 años de realizarlo, gracias a que Bartolo vive en una zona muy fértil él ha logrado obtener muy buenas cosechas y esto lo ha ayudado mucho, Bartolo ahora tiene la necesidad de cultivar pero el problema que tiene es que no tiene el capital suficiente, es la razón que lo motivo a solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de semillas de cebolla y compra de abono químico para que en esta temporada él logre cultivar.
El gran anhelo de Bartolo es que su cultivo incremente y con ello sus ingresos para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bartolo is a 41-year-old man who is married and has two children between the ages of six and eight. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

In order to make an income and support his family Bartolo works in agriculture. He learned this profession from his father and has now been doing it for ten years.
