The member belongs to the "Siempre Juntos" communal bank. Gerardo, the member, alternates his daily activities with the business of making mattresses. He is grateful for and values the loan. He pledges to make his monthly payments very responsibly. He wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting his family in this way.

He continues selling the mattresses to those customers who request them. He wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting his family. He is requesting the loan to buy springs and foam, among others.

loans.use: to buy springs, foam, and others.

loans.name: Inka Cancha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INKA CANCHA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Taray, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Virginia ella es casada y tiene 33 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Inka Cancha" lending group. This group is based in the Taray District in the Calca province of Cusco. 

Virginia is one of the members. She is married, 33 years old, and has two children. Virginia works selling vegetables, including, carrots, tomatoes and cucumbers.  She has a stall in the market that she uses to sell her vegetables.  She works from 8am to 5pm, and has worked in this business for 7 years. Her business has gone well but her dream is to have her own store.  

Virginia is seeking this loan to purchase onions, carrots and cucumbers.  The other members in the group have businesses that include vegetable sales, farming, grocery stores and restaurants.  The members are grateful for those who are part of making this dream come true through Kiva. They are committed to making their payments on time.

loans.use: purchase onions, carrots and cucumbers

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Zakayo, a small-holder mixed-farmer based in the Molo area of Kenya. Zakayo relies on livestock and crop farming to produce food and generate income.  His future plans are dependent on the success of his dairy farm and that is why he joined a solidarity group called Bidii (Swahili for effort) Development Group’to secure financial services. 
Zakayo is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will increase the number of livestock on his farm and the quantity of milk that he supplies. However, the impact of your loan goes beyond direct food production to include multipurpose uses, such as skins, fiber, fertilizer and fuel, as well as capital accumulation. 
Increased income generated from this loan investment will help Zakayo pay for his family’s basic needs as well as buy agricultural supplies, such as seed, fertilizer, pesticide, animal feed and implements to ensure sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone is a father of the land, who has drive and perseverance. He lives with his wife and 9 children, on a humble farm in the rural zone of Siongiroi. Up until now, he has had the spirit and courage to raise his children by his own means. His primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business he engages in to make ends meet.

Livingstone passionately loves dairy farming. When he was asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, he stated “feeding my cows.” His hobby is milking his cows. He sells milk to his neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and he cannot meet the demand. For this reason, he is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk production. The dairy cow that he plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and an increased income level. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and to grow his business enterprise further.

Livingstone is very visionary. he intends that in the near future, he will start adding value to his milk business through packaging the milk before selling. He also intends to begin selling dairy products, such as cream. An improved income level will assure his family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, he will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow and increase milk production

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Grace, a hardworking, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Grace is the proud mother of a lovely family whom she adores and always protects. Grace's upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming six years ago.

Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Grace is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. Grace is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming, so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticultural farming.

Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Grace is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticultural farming, Grace will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú, ella pertenece al banco comunal "SIEMPRE JUNTOS", la socia continua  trabajando en una entidad pública, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se  compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
texts.en: Edith lives in the city of Cusco in southern Peru. She belongs to the "Simper Juntos" lending group. Edith continues to work for a public entity. She is very grateful for this loan and she is committed to making the payments on time.  Edith has worked in her business for a long time, which is very satisfying for her. She hopes to continue working so that she can continue to support her family. She is seeking a loan to purchase a laptop.

loans.use: purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is a talented woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a big town with her family. She is divorced and has two children. She is working at a government agency as an operator.

Recently, she has not been feeling well. She wants to get herself tested at a medical clinic. But she does not have money to pay for medical service. She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to get treatment at a hospital and recover. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for medical service

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en:
Sobir is a generous man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1979. He is living in a small city famous for dry fruits. He is married and has four children. His wife is a housekeeper and is raising their children.

He works at a water company. Additionally he serves people with his tractor car to cultivate their lands. Recently, he is busy with pressing the wheat. His business is a partnership activity that rents a tractor car. He is responsible and has a good reputation.

Sobir appealed to IMON to get a loan to treat his old and sick father. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to treat his old and sick father

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
To further amplify her business scope, Edna humbly requests again, a loan for her Printing Press business. Here in her printing business, she purchases materials for printing and manufactures different printed materials according to the clients’ demands. Commonly, she offers signboards, sticker boards, tarpaulins and other related materials used for school, office and other business requirements.

Typically, in her four years in this trade, she earns from PHP 1,000-1,500 a day, undeniably sufficient to ease their family expenses. To mention, she previously had a loan from KIVA, which she used for continuing her business operations.

Now, she wants to ask for a PHP 30,000 loan that she would use to enhance her business. She will use this as an additional capital to buy needed materials for her enterprise. Edna hopes that you will help her effectuate her plan. She knows that this is her stepping-stone to pursue her dream of having another branch of Printing Press.

Today, she is saving for her children's education because she wants them to finish their schooling and get decent jobs someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy needed materials for her printing enterprise.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia owns and operates a food stall today. She has been successful in operating the business for many years, and she repaid her previous loans faithfully. From this inventory, she is able to suffice her household with their basic expenses.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profits. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities to be used for cooking her recipes. She is hopeful that you'll be able to help her with this.

Lydia hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future and be able to send her kids to college and finish their courses. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities to be used for cooking her recipes.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Elevating the lives of Filipino people is the goal of CCT. Through the years, many people have witnessed how this group of ministries was used to transform lives. This included Virgie's, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines.

2009 was the year when Virgie first joined CCT. At that time, she already had a "sari-sari" (variety) store business situated at Baclaran. Now, her business has already been operating for a long 10 years. Probably without the help of CCT, and her perseverance to work hard, her business would not have lasted this long. Today, she also has a Pedicab business that provides her income at the same time near her variety store (as seen in the picture).

She has four youngsters with her. Apparently, her husband left her earlier. Now, since her partner is deceased, she has to double her efforts in making money for her household. It was hard, but she's full of good spirits to provide her children with better living conditions.

To round it all up, she wants to inform you that she is planning to further improve her sari-sari store business and buy more products to display. She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan that would provide for her purposes. With integrity, she truly hopes for your full support regarding this matter.

Someday, she dreams that her businesses will grow even more and she prays for a parking place for her pedicab. At the same time, she is also praying that her children will have good professions in the future. Then she could finally say that all her hard work is worth it.

She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more products to display in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Corazon and previously she was granted a loan of PHP 10,000 for her junk shop business. Corazon was so glad that she was given a chance to secure a loan for the improvement of her business. 

Growing her inventory, she is asking again for your help. She believes that people like you can change her fate. She is taking out a loan of PHP 10,000 to incorporate into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. 

With optimism and hope, she envisions her children with their own professions after schooling. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.s

loans.use: to increase her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Clothing is indeed an unchangeable part of our lives. Due to this fact, Elvira found herself in the clothing industry. She is a very hard working entrepreneur from Pasay City, Philippines. As of now, she operates a buy-and-sell business of ready-to-wear products. Through this, she is able to gain a little profit which she basically uses for primary expenditures within the household.

She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells at retail, mostly people within her community. Products can range from ready-to-wear clothing to other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to favorable prices and the many options she offers.

With a humble heart, Elvira would like to take a 25,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she hopes to have her own stall for her business. She also desires for her grandchildren to be able to complete their studies and work abroad. She also prays for the health of their entire household.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, who is 24 years old and married to Jerry. 

She manages her sari-sari (convenience) store business in Intramuros, Manila City. She started this business two years ago and in 2014 was introduced to CCT. Being a new member, she was highly motivated to improve her business through the Word of God that she studies every week. She works hard to provide for the daily needs of her household. 

Sari-sari stores are seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is quite smaller than a usual general store and offers only limited commodities such as toiletries, food, and beverages. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low-cost which is really an advantage for the customers. Customers can also have credit which sometimes becomes a difficulty for Mary Ann when debts are not paid. 

Mary Ann wants to borrow PHP 10,000 to purchase additional merchandise for her store. With the loan, she expects to increase her sales and provide  better living conditions for her family. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.





She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her variety store.

loans.name: Matimtiman

texts.en:
Hi there lenders! 

Thanks for being a part of Matimtiman's journey. With your previous financial support, she established a business selling frozen products like longganisa (sausage). You are such a blessing! 

She has been dedicated and passionate about developing her business. Her everyday journey is often not as smooth-sailing as she dreams, but she strongly hopes to change her family's situation for the better. 

Matimtiman's been looking forward to more opportunities to increase her inventory. She's borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy quantities of frozen meats like sausages and tocino (grilled cured pork). 

She has proven already that she's faithful in repaying and hopes that you trust her once again. With hope and faith, Matimtiman believes she'll be able to earn more income to cover the basic needs of her family and that the household will stay united and have good health. 

As of today, Matimtiman's active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to meet her goals through the Word of God that she studies with her colleagues. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional processed and frozen meat products.

loans.name: Mibei

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Mibei, a smallholder mixed-farmer based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Mibei relies on livestock and crop farming to produce food and generate income. His family's future plans are dependent on the success of his dairy farm and that is why he joined a solidarity group called ‘Kaptwolo Blocks’ in order to secure financial services.

Mibei is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will increase the number of livestock in his farm and the quantity of milk that he supplies. However, the impact of your loan goes beyond direct food production to include multipurpose uses, such as skins, fibre, fertilizer and fuel, as well as capital accumulation.

Increased income generated from this loan investment will help Mibei to pay for his family’s basic needs as well as to buy agricultural supplies such as seed, fertilizers, pesticides, animal feed, and implements to ensure the sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his revolving fund to buy recyclable materials from customers.

loans.name: Ardanis Benjamin

texts.es: La vivienda en la que habita Ardanis de 23 años de edad es humilde, pero en ella vive feliz junto a su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que todos los días pone todo su esfuerzo y empeño en la elaboración ceviches y cocteles de mariscos y conchas, en un local cercano a la costa en el cual labora desde hace 3 años, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su hija. Ardanis desea mejorar su calidad de vida, por medio de la mejora de su vivienda, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para construir el corredor de su vivienda y de esta manera evitar que el agua ingrese a su vivienda.
texts.en:
The home where Ardanis, who is 23 years old, lives is humble. Nevertheless, he lives there happily with his small 4-year-old daughter. He is a hard-working man who puts forth all of his effort and determination every day to make ceviches and seafood cocktails in a stall near the coast. He has been performing this work for the past 3 years, and it allows him to move his daughter forward.

Ardanis wishes to better his quality of life by improving his home. For this reason, he decided to request a loan from FUSAI to buy metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire in order to build a roofed veranda around his home so that he can prevent water from entering his house.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire in order to build a roofed veranda around his home so that he can prevent water from entering his house.

loans.name: Valezka

texts.es: Valezka se dedica a la venta de ropa y otros artículos . Ella necesita un préstamo de ₡ 1 050 000 para la compra de ropa, zapatos y bolsos para la venta, con el fin de ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar las ganancias de su negocio.
texts.en: Valezka sells clothing and other items for a living.  She needs a loan of 1,050,000 CRC to purchase clothing, shoes, and handbags to sell, with the goal of offering more variety to her customers.  In this way, she seeks to increase her business's profits.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes and handbags to sell

loans.name: Gemeniano

texts.en:
Behind the walls of Intramuros City lives a reliable and hardworking father named Gemeniano, 55, a tricycle driver. He is married to Amalia, 50 years old, who works in a distant land as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). Away from each other sometimes, Gemeniano admits that he misses his wife. But, for their family' sake, the couple tries to understand, live and cope with their present situation. 

Gemeniano knows how hard it is to work abroad. That's another reason why he perseveres and works hard in his current job as a tricycle driver. For seven years, he has been driving people to and from their destinations. Each ride regularly costs PHP 8.00 per person, and each day he just earns enough. In a month, he can subsist on an average of PHP 9,000. 

However, it's a challenge for him when uncontrollable situations come, like heavy rains. At times like this, his motorcycle very often will not operate. 

Now, he comes to you to request a loan that he will use for buying another motorcycle. He needs an amount of PHP 8,000 for this. 

"I really dream of acquiring more motorcycles in time. And it would be a big help for me indeed if I get access to this loan. I hope Kiva will help me realize this so I can add income for the family," he said. 

He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that are each composed of 15 to 30 community partners and that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Hello there! The above picture presents Lilian, who lives in the Chuka area of Kenya, also known as the banana-growing region. Lilian is the mother of one lovely child and has been farming for the past twenty-five years. Through sheep farming and poultry keeping, she has been able to produce wool and eggs. Lilian is a very dedicated farmer who has a never-say-die attitude and enjoys every aspect of farming because it enables her to take care of her family’s needs and wants.

Although she experiences challenges, Lilian's attitude keeps her going and enjoying what she does. Lilian is seeking a 25,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow. This will allow her to increase her milk production and income, hence reducing the poverty that she and her family currently experience. Lilian's biggest goal is to emerge from poverty.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motor-pump.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Sammy, a smallholder mixed farmer based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Sammy depends on livestock and crop farming to produce food and generate income. His future plans are dependent on the success of his dairy farm, and that is why he joined a solidarity group called ‘Bingwa’ (Swahili word meaning champion) in order to secure financial services.

Sammy is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will increase the number of livestock on his farm and the quantity of milk that he supplies. However, the impact of your loan goes beyond direct food production to include multipurpose uses, such as skins, fibre, fertilizer and fuel, as well as capital accumulation.

Increased income generated from this loan investment will help Sammy pay for his family’s basic needs as well as buy agricultural supplies such as seed, fertilizers, pesticides, animal feeds and implements to ensure sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Langat

texts.en:
Hello, lenders.  Meet Langat, a smallholder and mixed farmer based in Siongiroi area of Kenya. Langat relies on livestock and crop farming to produce food and generate income. His future plans are dependent on the success of his dairy farm, and that is why he joined a solidarity group called ‘Tuiyo’ in order to secure financial services

Langat is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will increase the number of livestock on his farm and the quantity of milk that he supplies. However, the impact of your loan goes beyond direct food production to include multipurpose uses such as skins, fibre, fertilizer and fuel, as well as capital accumulation. 

Increased income generated from this loan investment will help Langat to pay for his family’s basic needs as well as to buy agricultural supplies, such as seed, fertilizers, pesticides, animal feeds and implements to ensure sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Yesica Alejandra

texts.es:
Yesica es una joven con 19 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, que desde hace poco logro iniciar con su propio negocio, preparación y ventas de comidas.
Para esta joven no hay nada imposible, sus ganas de salir adelante son muchas.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de una carpa, mesas, sillas, pipeta de gas y surtido de comida como lo es el aceite, harina, pan, carnes y salsas.
Sus sueños son muchos, pero el principal es continuar con sus estudios y en un futuro lograr comprarse una vivienda propia.

Ayuda a esta joven empresaria a cumplir sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Yesica is a 19-year-old young woman. She is hard-working and very humble. Recently, she was able to start her own business preparing and selling food. For this young woman, nothing is impossible, as she greatly desires to move forward.

She is requesting a loan to buy an awning, tables, chairs, a gas tank, and an assortment of food such as oil, flour, bread, meat, and sauces. She has many dreams, but her main goals are to continue with her studies and to be able to buy her own house in the future.

Help this young entrepreneur fulfill her dreams by making a loan!

loans.use: to buy an awning, tables, chairs, a gas tank, and an assortment of food such as oil, flour, bread, meat, and sauces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Merline

texts.fr:
Merline a 28 ans, et elle est mariée à un chauffeur non propriétaire de taxi-bus. Ils ont un enfant de deux ans pas encore scolarisé et la famille habite dans une maison appartenant à ses beaux parents et avec eux-même. 
Merline est marchande de légumes, et elle a commencé cette activité en 2009. Le prêt va lui permettre de renforcer son fonds de roulement c'est à dire augmenter les quantités et améliorer les qualités des marchandises. 
Son objectif est de construire sa propre maison dans deux ans au plus tard, car elle voudrait son indépendance vis à vis de ses beaux parents.
texts.en:
Merline is 28 years old and she is married to a taxi-bus driver. They have a child of 2 years old who is not in school yet and the family lives together in her parents-in-law's house.

Merline is a vegetable merchant and she started her business in 2009. The loan will allow her to reinforce her rolling funds - increase the quantity and improve the quality of her produce.

Her goal is to build her own house in two years time, as she would like to be independent of her parents-in-law.

loans.use: to buy 20 crates of tomatoes, 4 sacks of green beans, 5 sacks of white beans, and 5 sacks of bell peppers.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a remote district far from city with her family. She is married and has a son. Her husband is a pensioner. She is busy with keeping and doing business with livestock. She has ten year experience in agriculture. Her son helps her doing business. 

Her grandson is sick. She wants to treat him at a medical clinic. She is asking financial support to treat her grandson at medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to treat her grandson at medical clinic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, mosquito repellent, laundry soap, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Hello, lenders.  Meet Martin, a smallholder and mixed farmer based in the Kitale area of Kenya. Martin is married and has four children. He relies on livestock and crop farming to produce food and generate income.  His future plans are dependent on the success of his dairy farm, and that is why he joined a solidarity group called ‘Mt Sinai’ in order to secure financial services. 

Martin is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will increase the number of livestock on his farm and the quantity of milk that he supplies. However, the impact of your loan goes beyond direct food production to include multipurpose uses such as skins, fibre, fertilizer and fuel, as well as capital accumulation. 

Increased income generated from this loan investment will help Martin to pay for his family’s basic needs as well as to buy agricultural supplies such as seed, fertilizers, pesticides, animal feeds and implements to ensure the sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Satou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 23 Décembre 2014, lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. A ce jour le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même village, et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles pratiquent le commerce. 

Madame Satou (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 02 enfants dont 01 fille et 01 garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits locaux (arachide, céréales)Elle jouit d’une très grande expérience dans ce domaine.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant 05 sacs de mil  à 800f le sac et 03 sacs d’arachide à 11000f pour le revendre en détails les marchés hebdomadaires.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la gestion des charges familiales.
texts.en:
The group was created the 23rd of December, 2013, at the inception of their 'banc villageois'. To this day, the group is comprised of mostly women who have acquire solid experiences in small business, which is their main activity. They all live in the same village and share values of solidarity and mutual assistance. They practice business.

Madame Satou (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and a mother of 2 children, one boy and one girl. She works in local product sales (peanuts, grains) and benefits from a great experience in this domain.

This new loan will allow her to increase her stock of merchandise in buying 5 sacks of millet at 800f per sack and 3 sacks of peanuts at 11000f for resale in the weekly markets.

The profits will allow her to actively participate in managing her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of millet (at 800f per sack) and 3 sacks of peanuts (at 11000f) for resale at the weekly markets.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Esther, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpment of Kenya.

Esther, 43, has been farming for the past 20 years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet.

Esther is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds so that she can plant them and once the crops are ready for harvest she can sell them. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy seeds for planting.

Kenya's Kapsowar area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for crop produce. This means that Esther could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Esther, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Esther believes that this loan will be of much help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for crops. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Esther to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and assorted goods such as chips, biscuits, candies, noodles, canned goods, powdered milk, coffee, powdered juice, sugar and spices.

loans.name: Jocebel

texts.en:
Jocebel is 23 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, coffee, eggs, personal care products, etc.

Jocebel has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, coffee, eggs, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Mujeres Trabajadoras es un grupo que se formó en la comunidad de Duacari, zona rural del Cantón de Pococí. Todas son señoras del mismo lugar de vivencia, que se organizaron para buscar financiamiento para sus diferentes actividades productivas, debido a que se les hace más fácil unirse para lograr sus objetivos, los cuales con superarse para mejorar la calidad o condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias. La mayoría de las socias trabajan en sus parcelas, la cuales fueron donadas por el IDA actualmente el INDER, junto con su familia. Geraldine es la presidenta de éste grupo, la cual nombraron como lidereza, debido a que cumple con los requisitos para llevar el puesto. Es una mujer casada y madre de dos hijos. Uno de sus hijos cursa la primaria y el otro es menor de cinco años. Ella se dedica a la cria de pollos de engorde para luego venderlos en su comunidad y a trabajadores de la piñera, la cual es la única fuente de empleo en esa comunidad. Ella y su esposo cuidan los animales, debido a que El no cuenta con un trabajo estable y es llamado ocasionalmente a trabajar en la piñera, debido a ésto Geraldine inició su negocio con la finalidad de generar ingresos y ayudar en su hogar. Su meta es crecer y superarse. Junto con ella hay cuatro socias más que invertiran sus préstamos en la cria de animales como pollos, gallinas ponedoras y ganado.
texts.en: The Mujeres Trabajadoras (hardworking women) group, was formed in the Duacari community, located in the rural area of Canton in Pococi.  All the ladies are from the same living area, they got organized and looked for financing for different productive activities.  They thought it was easier to come together to achieve their goals, which are to improve the quality or conditions of life of them and their families.  Most of the group members work farming land with their families, which was donated by INDER (formerly IDA). Geraldine is the president of this group, the members chose her as leader because she meets the requirements for the job.  She is married and mother of two.  One of her children is in elementary school and the other one is under five years old.  She works raising chickens to sell them in the community and to workers of the pineapple plantation, which is the only source of employment in that community.  Her and her husband take care of the chickens, he doesn’t have a steady job and is employed occasionally at the pineapple plantation, this is why Geraldine started her business to generate income and help at home.  Her goal is to grow and improve.  With her four business partners they will invest the loan in buying livestock such as chickens, egg producing hens and cattle.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Rosela has a buy-and-sell sand and gravel business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sand and gravel to sell.

Rosela has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sand and gravel to sell.

loans.name: Dúo La Eminencia Group

texts.es:
Dúo la Eminencia 
Está integrado por Sandra Noemí quien tiene 2 hijos y desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de joyería (pulseras, cadenas, aretes, anillos, esclavas, etc.) y venta de ropa para dama (blusas, pantalones, vestidos, y ropa interior) y calzado para dama y caballero  ella solicita su crédito para invertir en su negocio ya  que se acerca la temporada donde aprovecha a surtir mas  porque sus ventas aumentan por la temporada de pago de bono que se le da a todos los  empleados, ella agradece por el apoyo que se le ha brindado ya que este es el 2do crédito que ella solicita y espera lograr acumular su ahorro para incrementar su capital y poder trabajarlo todo por mayor ya que le tiene cuenta comprarlo en mayor cantidad porque logra ahorrar más y obtener más ganancias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of 'Dúo la Eminencia'. She has two children.  For the past eight years she has been working selling jewelry (bracelets, chains, earrings, rings, identity bracelets, etc.), women's clothing (blouses, pants, dresses, and underwear), and footwear for men and women. Her sales are about to increase due to the approaching season in which all employees are paid their bonuses. Because of this, she is requesting a loan to invest in her business so that she can take this opportunity to stock on items.

She is thankful for the support given to her since this is the second loan that she requests. She hopes to accumulate her savings to increase her capital and purchase everything wholesale, because she understands this will allow her to save more and get more earnings from her business.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, and jewlery to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 27 years old, married and supporting three children. 

Joan sells vegetables and other farm supply business for the last two years, earning a profit of 5,000 KES per month.

Joan has applied for her first loan of 15,000 KES from VFK to buy more vegetables and other farm supplies for selling. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

She dreams of becoming the best farmer in the village and thus expanding her farming.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and other farm supplies for selling

loans.name: Thokozani

texts.en: Thokozani is applying for a third loan to support his studies through graduation in 2015 at the Maharishi Institute.He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the second loan: " My studies are going well currently, I am able to concentrate on my studies without having to stress about transport fare and all other financial issues.The Kiva loan will help me to pay the balance of my fees for the year 2015, I am grateful with the support I have been getting from Kiva".

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers as top dressing for his farm crops.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose who is married with one baby. She got married early and did not manage to go college in her earlier years and she has gone back to school to improve the lives of her family. She desires to be a teacher and get to encourage young girls to pursue their education before they start families.

She is currently pursing Bachelor of Education (ARTS) and she is in her final year of study and with the many responsibility on her; she is having a hard time raising her tuition fees. With a Kiva loan, she will be able to pay her tuition fees and complete her studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition costs for her BA in Education

loans.name: Olrongai Mwangaza S. H .g. Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Olrongai Mwangaza S.H.G Group. Mary is sixty four years old, married and blessed with five children; she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.
Mary does maize and beans farming, having gone through HiH EA enterprise and financial training, she has been able to commercialize her business and earn profit.
She is taking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, this will increase the quality of her yields thus earn more income. With the increased income Mary will be able to meet her family basic needs such education and medical care.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will increase crop yields thus earn more income. With the increased income Mary will be able to meet her family basic needs.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina pertenece al  banco comunal “Siempre Juntos”.
La socia sigue dedicándose a trabajar como asistente en una veterinaria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de accesorios para perros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the communal bank “Siempre Juntos” (Always Together). 
She continues to work as a veterinary assistant. 
She has been working in the business for a while and does well thanks to the effort she puts in every day.  Her work brings her personal satisfaction and wants to continue working to keep helping her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy accessories for dogs.
The member is grateful for this loan, and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy accessories for dogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize, pawpaws and watermelons; she hopes this will help her sell more maize and fruits to her customers.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Martha, a member of Visoi Dairy Self Help Group; she is forty years old, a single mother with six children. 
Martha joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She learned and gained experience from the trainings she underwent on enterprise development and financial management. Her main economic activity is vegetable farming. She farms cabbages in her small piece of land. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds to boost her farming business. This will help get more income thus be in a position to meet her family needs such as clothing, food, better shelter and education for her children. 

She is happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the great support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds to boost her farming business. This will help her get more income thus be in a position to meet her family needs.

loans.name: Jodak School

texts.en: Greetings from Uganda! This is Lazarus. He is the Headteacher of Jodak School, a mixed school in the rural area of Luwero with 420 students. Jodak School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Jodak School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Lazarus ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tujipange Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Siprosah, a member of Tujipange women group in Nakuru Kenya.  She is twenty six years old, married and blessed with four children. Siprosah joined Hand in hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014.
She does maize, beans, vegetable and poultry farming. HiH EA enterprise training has enabled her manage the enterprise well hence earn more profit. 

She is taking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and chicken feeds that will improve quality and quantity of her yields thus maximize profit. Income from this enterprise will help take care of her family basic needs, education and medical care.

She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers seeds and chicken feeds that will improve quality and quantity of her yields thus maximize profit.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet John, a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Kitale area of Kenya. John is married and has three children. He relies on livestock and crop farming to produce food and generate income. His future plans are dependent on the success of his dairy farm and that is why he joined a solidarity group called ‘Nabal’ in order to secure financial services.

John is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will increase the number of livestock on his farm and the quantity of milk that he supplies. However, the impact of your loan goes beyond direct food production to include multipurpose uses, such as skins, fiber, fertilizer and fuel, as well as capital accumulation. Increased income generated from this loan investment will help John pay for his family’s basic needs as well as buy agricultural supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, animal feed and implements to ensure sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hens and pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Sanguon's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote area of Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Sanguon is 23-year-old and she is a young mother of a small child. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming. She spends her free time to raise pigs and buy scrap to earn additional income to support her living condition. She has been involved in these businesses for five years. Her businesses earn her about 25,000KHR per and she is able to save around 9,000KHR each day after offsetting her family expenses. Lacking of water for her rice fields is the problem for her business. 

For Sanguon, she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loan cycles already and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. The previous loans have helped her to improve her living lifestyle. 

She is now leading a group of two members to take a new loan of 1,000,000KHR for each. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy a motorbike to drive her from home to her rice field. She hopes that this loan will help her to work on time and get more income to upgrade her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to drive her from home to her rice field.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Virginiah. She is fifty nine years old, a single parent to seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. 
Virginia is a farmer growing maize and beans. Prior to joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she was not able to keep her farming records. After undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management, Virginiah gained knowledge on business management. 

She is borrowing from Kiva in order to buy fertilizer to increase her farm produce and thus increase income from the sale of maize and beans to her customers. She hopes this extra income will enable her cater for her family’s needs such as food, shelter and school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her farm produce and thus increase income from the sale of maize and beans to her customers.

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en:
Saeda is a 40-year-old married woman from a village near Ramallah. She lives with her husband and three kids. Saeda has been working as an employee in a sewing workshop for one year. She would like to open her own sewing workshop so she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy new sewing machines for her new business. This will increase her income and her ability to be independent. 

Saeda appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines for her new business.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is grateful that she has repeatedly received and has faithfully repaid loans granted to her in the past. It has helped to sustain and continue her general store business. Although she sometimes experienced bad debts and typhoons that hit the country recently, she continues to persevere and knows that in no time her store's sales will pick up.

To help improve and regain sales from her small general store, Paz is humbly asking for financial assistance of PHP 20,000 to fill her store with essential food items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, eggs, oil, bread and beverages. Her store earnings are her way of providing for her family's food and household needs. She is thanking God for your good heart and your tireless support for her livelihood. 

Paz's simple dream is to grow and expand her store business and improve her family's quality of life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and other products for her general store.

loans.name: Tong's Group

texts.en:
Tong, 40, lives in the Kampong Thom province and is a married mother blessed with two dependent children. One of her children, in school, needs her support to study in order to have a bright future. 

To make a living, she grows rice and sells grocery items. She sometimes works as a paid worker to supplement the family’s income. There was insufficient water to supply her rice farmland due to drought, so her business can only earn her about 21,800 KHR (around $5.30) a day. Tong decided to form a group of three members to apply for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); this is the fourth time for her. The past loan was successfully paid back and it enabled her to buy household appliances and school supplies for her child to study. 

Tong, as group leader, will use her loan to build a decent latrine for her family to use. She hopes that all of her family members can live healthily and avoid infectious diseases.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family to use.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
A woman farmer is 46 years old living in Siem Reap province, Mon has five dependent children, two of whom are in school. Nowadays, she does rice farm and raises pigs for twenty-eight years. She can earn income around 25,000KHR per day and she is able to save about 11,000KHR each day to support her family living. Flooding is the main challenge for her rice farming business. 

This is her first time to apply for a new loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of two members, will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will help her to gain high yields to earn more income to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a hardworking lady from central Kenya who is passionate about agriculture. She is married and has three children. She started farming 25 years ago on her 2.5-acre land. Today, she practices dairy, poultry and crop farming. She also runs a small retail shop to make extra shillings.

Catherine is seeking a loan to add more poultry on her farm. With your loan, she will increase the number of hens from 20 to over 60. Such an increase in the heads of poultry will save her in terms of costs and increase the income she makes from selling poultry products significantly.

With the increased income, she will be able to grow her farm and generate enough income to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Don Mauricio de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene mas de 30 años de trabajar en la agricultura, vende sus productos agrícolas en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Mauricio is 56 years of age and lives in his own home with his wife. He makes a living in the cultivation of corn and beans. He has worked in agriculture for more than 30 years. Mauricio sells his agricultural products in the surrounding area of the zone he lives in and with what he obtains from his sales, he succeeds in settling some household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph so that he will have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda lives in Solana with her family. She is managing a general store to earn money. Her family are also farmers who are involved in agriculture as another source of income. 

Rosalinda would like to increase her earnings to be able to save for her family's expenses. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy grocery items (canned goods, breads, eggs, biscuits, soft drinks) to sell. This way she will meet all her customers' demand for goods at the affordable prices she offers.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Sub Group B

texts.en:
Twitezimbere is a group led by Jeannette who is 36 years old. The group name means “support each other” in English. She has been a group leader for one year. She sells clothes and has been selling in a business for 20 years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and dresses to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Flocima

texts.en:
Flocima has a lot of experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities like growing, cultivating and harvesting and earns income as well. Flocima has supported her husband doing this type of work.  

Like farming, Flocima has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will potentially improve her yield. Someday, Flocima hopes to purchase more land to cultivate to potentially earn more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to improve her rice yield.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, the farmer, lives in Siem Reap province and is 39 years old. She is a married mother who has three children. There are two of her children depending on her and need her great support. Additionally, she still has one child who is in school to support the studies. Oun has been working hard on her rice farming business for 21 years to earn the main source of income. She is also growing vegetables to resell in market. The rice crop, which was expected to produce good outputs, was severely threatened by pests. Thus, she can earn about 30,000KHR per day to support family’s needs. 

This is Oun’s first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of four-member group, Oun will use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to improve the crop’s growth. She hopes to get more crop yields from her business so that she can upgrade her lifestyle much better.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to improve the crop’s growth.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Prasat Bakong district

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замира позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет четырех детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Замира мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Замиру выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Замира никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Замира вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством.Замира выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Замира получает хороший доход. Муж Замиры также работает в местной мастерской столяром и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Замира с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Замира заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Zamira is an optimistic and hardworking woman. She is married and has four children. She lives in a small rural town. From childhood Zamira dreamed of becoming a teacher, but her family's lack of financial resources was an obstacle to higher education that she could not overcome. She married right after finishing high school, and became a housewife. Even being at home all the time, she is never still. She and her husband do all they can to provide everything their children need.

In order to earn a reliable income for necessities Zamira and her husband started their own business in animal husbandry. Zamira raises livestock, and sells their milk and meat. She earns a good income doing this. Her husband also works in a local workshop as a cabinet maker and brings in additional income for the family. Together their earnings are enough to live at an average level. Still, they don't have enough to cover all their needs. Now Zamira and her husband want to buy a few more animals to feed. To do this she contacted Arvand for a loan to buy cattle. Zamira thanks Arvand in advance for the support, which will lead to a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is married and she has three children. She is a business women with a small kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business and also to improve her management. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as cigarettes, candles, rice, milk, biscuits, cooking oils, salt, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. 

Domingas opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $200. She is happy with the loan that Tuba Rai Metin has offered for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. Domingas also cultivates animals like cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, candles, rice, milk, biscuits, cooking oils, salt and other things to sell.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 49 years old, married woman; she has been doing a business of crockery’s sales for many years with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. Her husband also assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in local market. She makes sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf  Foundation and has availed Murabaha loan of 10000 PKR to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs

loans.name: Jubilee Upendo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Esther, a member of Jubilee Upendo Women Group. She is 58 years old, married with 9 children.

She joined hand in hand eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from courses on enterprise development and financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management.

Esther is able to advance her business of poultry keeping through proper recording and using the profits properly.

 With these skills she is able to educate her children and also provide them with enough food and clothing. Esther is taking a Kiva loan to purchase chicken feeds to boost productivity. She appreciates Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicken feeds to boost productivity thus improve income.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Alfred; fifty one years old, married and has three children. He joined hand in hand eastern Africa in 2013 to be trained on entrepreneurial skills. This has helped him expand his poultry business by maximizing potential market, keeping proper records and incorporating entrepreneurial culture in agriculture.

 He is borrowing from Kiva to buy more chicken and chicken feeds so as to produce more chicken in order to meet the rising demand from his customers. He hopes his business will earn more profit to enable him cater for his children school fees and general family needs.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to his loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and chicken feeds  to produce more chicken in order to meet the rising demand from his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay this semester university fees in Finance and Banking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production and hopes this will enable her to get milk for sale and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Zeudy Mabel

texts.es:
Zeudy tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rústico con sus dos menores hijos, en la una zona rural del distrito de Pucará que pertenece a la Provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Zeudy es la venta de cerveza, cuenta con más de 2 años dedicándose al negocio en este rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con mayor cantidad de productos con ello generar mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zeudy is 27 years old. She lives in her family's home, which is made of rustic materials, with her two underage sons. She lives in a rural area of the Pucará District, wich is part of the Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, in the northern sierra of Peru.

Zeudy works in the sale of beer, and has been doing so for over 2 years. She will use the loan to invest in her business, stocking it with a greater amount of products so she can generate more income, and by doing so improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in her business, stocking it with a greater amount of products.

loans.name: Hovakim

texts.en:
Hovakim with his wife, two sons lives in the frontier village Khachardzan of Tavush region. Hovakim’s wife is employed and she works at the school as a teacher and his sons are still school-aged. Hovakim also has higher pedagogical education but he never worked in that sphere. He is farmer and he likes his farming activities. He takes care of cows, a heifer, calves, a pig, goats, bee colonies and also chickens on his farm. 

On his plot of land Hovakim cultivates fruits and vegetables (apple, apricot, fig and plum and also potato, beans and tomato). 

Hovakim finds especially profitable his goat breeding. He sells goat milk, which is very famous of its healing and useful qualities and also cheese made of goat milk (his wife makes it). Now this loan of 600.000 Armenian drams Hovakim asks as he wants to enlarge the number of his farm goats; he will buy 17 goats for his farm and he calculated that this loan amount will be enough for this profitable purchase.

loans.use: to buy 17 goats for his farm in order to enlarge the number in his herd and for greater profits

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Sevan, a city of Gegharkunik region. She is 39 years old and she has two sons (the elder is a student now). Anna has a vocational medical education, but never having chance to work in that sphere, she began in her farm. She has cows, calves, lambs, sheep and a lot of chickens.

Anna is divorced and she works hard to provide her sons with good living conditions. She sells her farm’s milk, cheese, curd, meat and eggs. Since she is alone in farming works, Anna manages to organize all of it; she takes care of cattle, feeds it, milks and makes different dairy-products of that milk. She sells her farm products at the wholesale market during the week. Anna asks for this loan, as she wants to buy a lot of fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn used to work in construction in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. Now he is a farmer, and rather seriously engaged in it. Vahagn lives on this nice farm with his wife, sons and his parents. 

Vahagn works on the farm nearly all day long and his wife surely helps him with the care of cows, calves, a bull and chickens. His wife makes the tastiest cheese and butter and she sells it to their neighbors. On his plot of land, Vahagn cultivates very good potatoes and sells them at a profit to wholesalers that regularly visit their village. 

Vahagn will be very thankful if Kiva lenders help him with money as he wants to buy a calf and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a hard working lady from kayonza -Kabare rubindi, Mbarara district.  She is professional nurse and runs a drugshop in mbarara town. Though she does farming as her main source of income. She says she gets good income from this plantation since there is market from the town dwellers in Mbarara. 

Roseline gets enough money from matooke but she says she needs farm inputs in the form of manure to spread in this plantation so that she can get increased yields and earn more from it and be able to educate her children being a single mother. She has applied for a loan of ugx4,000,000  She has high hopes of expanding her plantation so that she can get more output from her plantation

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy molasses to brew alcohol.

loans.name: Ndinda

texts.en:
Ndinda is fifty three years old, married and a mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training especially enterprise development. 

Her economic activity is mixed farming. She also operates a general retail shop where she sells commodities like sugar, salt, tea, soap, cooking fat and other household items. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more stock of salt, sugar, cooking fat and tea leaves hence earn more income. This will make her be in a position to pay school fees for her three children in school and also provide better food.

Ndinda is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more of stock of salt,sugar,cooking fat for her general retail shop for increased income to enable her provide better food and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is forty one years old, married and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.
She does poultry keeping and is borrowing Kiva loan to buy chicken feeds and vaccines. This will enable her produce quality chicken hence more income to buy food and clothes for her children.
Eunice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicken feeds and vaccines hence produce quality chicken for more income to buy food and clothes for her children.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 61 years old and she lives with her husband in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Their two children are already married and they live with their families. 

Emma is an engineer and has worked in that field for many years. Her husband provides taxi services in his own car. Emma would like some money to make repairs to their old flat, which has already been repaired over the last 35 years. Several years ago they started to do some works but the lack of money made them to leave it half-done. Now Emma is asking for this loan as she wants to finally finish the repairing of their house and make it nice and comfortable as it was many years ago, when she was just married.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Kyunguni Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Juliana. She is 35 years old, a mother of four children and a member of Kyunguni Women Group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development. 

She practices mixed farming, and mostly farms maize, bananas and beans which she sells to the locals from her home. She also makes and sells detergents e.g. liquid soap, shampoo and glycerin, to supplement her income. She is seeking a Kiva loan to pay for the construction expenses for a shop where she will be selling her farm produce and detergents. This she believes, will attract more customers hence earn more income to enable her pay school fees and provide better food to her four children.

Juliana is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to pay for construction expenses of a shop for selling farm produce and detergents.

loans.name: Rubabe

texts.en:
Rubabe is 54 years old, married and the mother of four kids. She is from Agdas. 

Rubabe is a dairy farmer. She is an honest, hard-working and successful person. She started keeping dairy cows 25 years ago. Ever since, Rubabe has developed and grown her business steadily to a point where she is able to get more then 12 litres of milk every day which she sells to her customers in the local bazaar. 

When she was young she started this business with an amount of small capital. Rubabe grown up in her village and is attached to this place and her family, so she does this work with great love and passion. Now Rubabe wants to grow her business and buy a few more cows to improve both her business and family conditions. 

Rubabe has taken loans twice from Agroinvest in the past and always made repayments on time. She looks forward to support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more cows and grow her business.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 31-years-old married woman from a village near Qalqilia. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband works as an employee where he gets a low income. 

Abeer has been working as an employee in a sewing workshop for one year.  Now she would like to open her own sewing workshop. So she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy new sewing machines for her new business. This will increase her income and be independent. 
Abeer appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines for her new business.

loans.name: Dinora Guadalupe

texts.es: Dinora es una mujer de 29 años de edad que habita en vivienda de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 5 años de edad, al que ella y su compañero de vida luchan por dar lo mejor. Dinora vive cerca de una playa muy visitada por turista, y desde hace 3 años presta sus servicios en una pupusería, lo que le permite apoyar a su compañero de vida con los gastos económicos de su hogar y apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios. La vivienda de Dinora se encuentra en una zona peligrosa, por lo que ella desea resguardar a seguridad de su familia reconstruyendo un cerco alrededor de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, postes de cemento, clavos y hierro para reconstruir el cerco alrededor de su vivienda y de esta manera cuidar de la seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Dinora is a woman of 29 years of age. She lives in her own home, together with her life partner and her five-year-old child, whom she and her life partner fight to give the best. Dinora lives near a beach that is often visited by tourists, and for three years she has offered her services at a pupusería (a food stand), which has allowed her to support her life partner with household financial expenses and to support her child’s schooling.

Dinora’s home is located in a dangerous area, which is why she wishes to protect her family’s security by rebuilding a fence around her home. For this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheeting, cement posts, nails and iron, to rebuild the fence around her home and thus take care of her family’s security.

loans.use: invest in metal sheeting, cement posts, nails and iron, to rebuild the fence around her home and thus take care of her family’s security.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sewing equipment and materials to make dresses and suits.

loans.name: Ruth Leyni Margareth

texts.es:
La socia Ruth pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS, la socia alterna  sus actividades diarias   con la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros más, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia sala adelante y apoya a su familia.
