La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, gaseosas entre otros.
texts.en:
Ruth belongs to the “Siempre Juntos” (“Always Together”) communal bank. She sells staple products, such as rice, sugar, noodles, and oil. She is a responsible and persevering person. She sells her merchandise to her customers; this is how she supports her family. 

Ruth is grateful for the loan and is committed to making the repayments on time.

She is requesting the loan so she can buy milk, soft drinks, and other merchandise.

loans.use: to buy milk, soft drinks, and other items

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married and there are 10 members including her husband at home, so they are a big family. She has been involving in business activities since 2013, she started with her own working capital of $400.00. She has a kiosk in her house and she is taking loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin, she will buy additional supplies with the loan including sugar, noodles, hand body, biscuits, rice, cooking oils, detergents, Including hard drinks and other things to sell. 

She hopes to open a big store in the future, so that she can be helping her family and her children can be going to school. She also cultivates animals like cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To buy sugar, noodles, hand body, biscuits, rice, cooking oils, detergents, Including hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from Badian, Cebu. She is 34 years old, married, and has four children. The oldest child is 14 years old and the youngest child is 9 years old. Her husband is a fisherman, while she has been engaged in raising hogs for 25 years. Aside from this, Virginia sells fish from her husband’s catch.

To upturn her earnings she needs additional capital to buy feed for her swine. In the future, she aims to expand her business and have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy feed for her swine.

loans.name: Hunan

texts.en:
This young man’s name is Hunan and he is 26 years old and he lives in Ddmashen village of Gegahrkunik region. Hunan after graduation from the institute Armenian History greatly hoped to work in his specialty, but now he manages a work completely different from his specialty. 

Hunan works at the police station and he also runs a farm. Hunan now lives with his father and sister. So he and his father do their best to earn a better living for their small family. The main income for this family is farming in which Hunan is seriously engaged. 

On the farm he has cows, calves, pigs and chickens. The sale of milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat and eggs Hunan organizes locally or at the wholesale market. Potato cultivation makes a part of family income and its sale is very profitable for any family living in this region. With this loan Hunan needs as he wants to buy diesel fuel his farm equipment and he must also buy a calf and cattle fodder.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel his farm equipment and he must also buy a calf and cattle fodder

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS, la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de venta de tripas de cordero, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cabezas de cordero.
texts.en: This partner belongs to the communal bank SIEMPRE JUNTOS [ALWAYS TOGETHER], the partner is in the business of selling lamb’s intestines and conducts her sales in one of the markets of the city of Cusco. The partner has had her business for quite some time and it brings her personal satisfaction. She continues to sell her products to her customers that request them and wishes to be able to continue working in order to keep supporting her family in this way. The partner is requesting the loan for the purchase of lamb’s heads.

loans.use: to buy lamb’s heads.

loans.name: Susana De Los Angeles

texts.es: Susana de 24 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 4 años de edad en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado desde hace tres años, eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes. Susana  es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor para ella y su familia, últimamente la demanda de sus productos se a incrementado y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar ropa y calzado para damas, caballeros y niños como: trajes, faldas, blusas, ropa interior, sandalias, etc.
texts.en:
24-year-old Susana lives in her own house with her partner and four-year-old child. She has made a living for the past three years by selling clothes and shoes; this has given her a lot of experience that enables her to obtain greater profits. The business is located in her home. She has a large clientele because people know that everything she sells is of good quality and that she has reasonable prices and offers unbeatable service tailored to the needs of the customer. 

Susana is an enterprising woman. She is dedicated to her work and very determined. Each day she does her utmost to secure a better life for her family. Recently demand for her products has increased and she wants to make the most of this opportunity by investing more into her business, but she does not have enough capital to do so; for this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, which will enable her to buy clothes and shoes for women, men and children, such as suits, skirts, blouses, underwear, and sandals.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for women, men and children, such as suits, skirts, blouses, underwear, and sandals

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 23 years old and has one child. She is a farmer and has been growing cash crops for the last 5 years.

She will be using the loan to buy a dairy cow so as to get milk for sell and make more income to expand her farming and support her family.

She plans to use the generated profits to educate her children and buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. Her future hopes and dreams are expand her farming by growing more cash crops, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to get milk for sell and make more income to expand her farming and support her family.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a refrigerator repair business in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance for her refrigerator repair business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance for her business

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik with her husband, daughter (who is student), son and retired mother-in-law lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She has higher education of pedagogue, and she over 23 years work at the school as a teacher of elementary classes. 

Hasmik is very clever and patient woman and she likes her profession and she finds it important and precious one. She also helps some pupils with their lessons and thanks to her help they overcome their hardships in education process. Hasmik manages also farming with her beloved husband and she is happy both with her school work and her work about the farm. Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Hasmik needs for the purchase of a computer, some accessories for it and also some professional literature for self-development in the sphere of pedagogy.

loans.use: for the purchase of a computer, some accessories for it and some professional literature for self-development in the sphere of pedagogy

loans.name: Mbaa Matu Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is in the photo is Saphina; a member of Mbaa Matu SHG Group. She is 53 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development. She does poultry farming.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more indigenous chicks and poultry feed. This will increase production, and hence earn more income. She intends to use the increased profits to pay for construction expenses of a modern poultry structure.

Saphina is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more indigenous chicks and poultry feed to increase poultry production and use the profits to construct a modern poultry structure.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia  is a 36 years old, married woman. Her husband(also shown in the photo) has been actively running a ‘Tandoor’ in his locality for many years. A tandoor (clay oven) is used for cooking chapattis and naan especially in Pakistan. He cooks chapattis and naan with flour, salt and oil then sells them to the people of his community. He also takes orders from nearby hotels and makes enough money to have a decent life. 

 For the improvement of her husband's business Safia  has applied for Murabaha loan 25000 PKR  to purchase more sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil. She dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil

loans.name: Gohari

texts.en:
Gohari  is a 62 years old, widow . The man shown in the photo is her son, who is a taxi driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. 

He wants to change the taxi's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Gohari has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 20000 PKR for her son to buy a new engine for the taxi to provide better facilities to his customers. Gohari is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her son's taxi to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Rukui Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Ngandi, forty-five years old, married, and blessed with six children. She is a member of Rukui SHG Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014. She has benefited a lot through HiH EA training, especially on how to manage her business as well as recordkeeping.

She does mixed farming, growing vegetables and rearing dairy cattle. She is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a calf in order to increase her milk productivity, which will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: to buy a calf for rearing, and on maturity, increase milk production and thus enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Sub Group B

texts.en:
Claudine is a group leader. She is aged 33 years. She is married with two children, aged 3 and 6 years.

The group is called Twitezimbere, which means “Let us support each other” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses for changing their future for the better.

Claudine has been selling foodstuffs and has been running a business for 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava, beans, and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, beans, and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Sammuel

texts.en:
Sammuel is fifty three years old, married and a father of five children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training especially enterprise development. 

He is involved in poultry keeping and is taking a Kiva loan to buy more chicks, feeds and vaccines. This will enable him increase poultry production and earn more income to meet family's basic needs e.g. food, healthcare, clothing and education for her children.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more chicks, feeds and vaccines to boost poultry production hence earn more income to meet family's needs e.g. food,healthcare,clothing and school fees.

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar is 55 years old and married with three children. She is from Imishli and is a successful and very diligent woman.  Nigar is a farmer where she started to work  24 years ago . She wants to plant new fruit trees, to grow different fruits and then sell them in the market. She gives importance to human lives, that’s why she grows organic.  In addition in Azerbaijan  people prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because they are naturally raised and cheaper. People know that such products are always fresh and healthy; they are not grown with different pesticides and are not harmful. 

During long years of experience, Nigar was taught how to cover customer`s demands. So, selling fruits and vegetables from houses is popular and cheaper for people than buying them in bazaars and big markets. Her biggest dream is to expand her land and to plant more seeds. But, for this, she has to have some funds. With this loan she will purchase more land and sow more seeds. We need Kiva lenders to support Nigar.

loans.use: purchase more land and sow more organic seeds and plant fruit trees also

loans.name: Nhóm 5-Kp12_Bắc Sơn-Bỉm Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhâm is 56 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has worked in agriculture growing industrial crops for more than 10 years.

Nhâm lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and moreover this job is unstable.

The main hardship that Nhâm faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle and poultry to resell.

In 2014, Nhâm joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Nhâm has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 5-KP12-Bắc Sơn-Bỉm Sơn, which consists of 4 members.

With her business profit, Nhâm hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and poultry to resell.

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en: Rajaa is a 47-year-old married mother of three. Five years ago she decided to quit the agriculture business and establish her current convenience store. She is a hard working woman who puts a lot of effort in supporting her husband in making their living and covering their family's increasing living needs. Her business income is good, but not enough to cover unexpected living needs. Thus for this reason, Rajaa decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary home improvements for the rooms ceilings before the coming winter season so that her house stays a healthy living place.

loans.use: to make necessary home improvements for the rooms ceilings before the coming winter season so that her house stays a healthy living place.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
This is Zeinab, a 53-year-old widowed mother of three children who has been working in dairy products production since her husband passed away to make sure she can provide her family with the necessary living needs.  Zeinab is a hard working woman who puts so much effort to develop her business and increase her family's income.
Zeinab produces a very special home made Yogurt, and thick Yogurt "Labneh", which is highly requested by some people who prefer home made dairy products.

Zeinab had previous experience in selling cars, as an additional income business she is working on bringing this business back on track.
Thus, for this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay necessary harbor fees for a car she imported to sell in Lebanon in parallel to her current Dairy products business.
She hopes to be capable of expanding and developing both businesses in a well managed way.

loans.use: To pay necessary harbor fees for a car she imported to sell in Lebanon in parallel to her current Dairy products business

loans.name: Dilbarniso

texts.en:
Dilbarniso is a generous woman and was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is divorced and has four children. She is challenged and hardworking woman.  She has done business in agriculture for six years and keeps livestock and plants agricultural products. Her income is not enough to pay her son’s higher education costs. 

She requested a loan to pay her son’s tuition fee of studies. She hopes someday his son would be a professional economist and help her in hard times, when she will be older. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries, cell phone cases and prepaid phone cards to sell

loans.name: Morning Star Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Joyce, a member of Morning star women group in Nakuru Kenya.  She is fifty two years old, married and blessed with three children. Joyce joined Hand in hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014.

She does maize, beans and vegetable farming. HiH EA enterprise training has enabled her manage the enterprise well hence earn more profit. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds that will improve quality and quantity of her yields thus maximize profit. Income from this enterprise will help her take care of family basic needs such as education and medical care.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds that will improve quality and quantity of her yields thus maximize profit.

loans.name: Paruyr

texts.en:
Paruyr is 26 years old and he lives with his family, his parents and sister in Kapan, a city of Syunik region. Paryur and his father work at the city’s combine, but at the same time they are engaged in agricultural works.

Paruyr, with the help of his father, planted trees of apples, cherries, figs and mulberries. He also has a rich vegetable garden where he cultivates beans, potatoes, carrots and greens. All this harvest he divides in two parts, for the family and to sell. Paruyr wants to make his orchard and vegetable garden more attractive and accurate. He needs this loan for fencing his garden and he will buy wires for this fence also.

loans.use: to pay for fencing his garden and to also buy wires for this fence.

loans.name: Loeury's Group

texts.en:
Loeury is 29 years old and a mother who has three children relying on her. While two of them are under age of school, the other one is already in school and needs her special support for studying. She lives in a rural area of Siem Reap province where she has been growing rice and cassava for ages to earn income. Moreover, she brings up chickens to earn additional income. As the crop was destroyed by pests and the chickens got ill, Loeury can earn only about 35,000KHR a day for a living. 

This is the second cycle for Loeury with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid back her past loan successfully. The past loan was useful and enabled her to improve the standard of living better. As the leader of a group of two members, Loeury will use her loan to support her rice farming business by purchasing rice seeds and paying for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more income to buy piglets to bring up to increase the income.

loans.use: to support her rice farming business by purchasing rice seeds and paying for plowing fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Leonald

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Leonald. He is fifty-five years old, married, and a father of three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 and has benefited through the training on how to keep records and also manage his enterprise.

He does horticulture farming to earn his living. He is borrowing a loan to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase his profit. This will enable him to cater for his needs and that of his family, i.e. food and clothing.

Leonald is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan well.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase profits to enable him to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Wendani Guardians Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Pauline, forty-four years old and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to gain skills on how to run and expand her business through enterprise and financial management training. She operates a salon and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy a blow dryer and add stock of cosmetics.

She is very sure the Kiva loan will improve her living standards through easy provision of food and clothes for her family. She will also pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy a blow dryer and stock to improve her business, and thus be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Dúo Guapinol Group

texts.es:
Dúo Guapinol
Karen tiene 20 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa para toda la familia en un local cerca de su comunidad, inicio su negocio hace un año, cuando termino sus estudios a nivel medio, ella se dedica a atender su negocio por las tardes y los fines de semana por las mañanas se dedica a estudiar, emplea una persona en su negocio para que atienda el local por las mañanas, solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa nueva para surtir su negocio y tener variedad, el sueño de ella es seguir estudiando y seguir luchando para selir adelante.
texts.en: Karen is 20 years old. She makes a living by selling clothes in a store near her community. She began her business a year ago when she finished high school. She looks after her business in the afternoons and on the weekends. She spends her mornings studying and employs a person to look after the business in the mornings. She is requesting the loan so she can buy new clothes in order to have greater variety in her business. Her dream is to continue studying and working to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: La Retama Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA RETAMA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy ella es soltera y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de bazar, la socia vende regalos y adornos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de bazar. La socia solicita el  credito para comprar adornos y peluches.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “LA RETAMA” communal bank. which is located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member Nancy is 36 years old, single and has two children. She works in her novelty business selling gifts and decorations. She works from 8 am until 6 pm. She has been in this business for a number of years and things are going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business. She is requesting the loan to buy decorations and stuffed toys.

The member in the photo attached to the group photo had permission to arrive late due to her work and had her photo taken after the meeting. The other members work in their businesses selling handicrafts, clothing sales, a grocery store and a food business.

Nancy thanks those who form part of this dream through the loan and promises to comply with the loan installments in the established time.

loans.use: to buy decorations and plush toys.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, a 55-year-old store owner from San Lucas, Barotac Viejo Iloilo, has been a member of CCT for eight (8) years already. Nida chose to run a sari-sari store business since Filipinos prefer to buy goods in a place that is near to their homes rather than waste it on transportation fares going to markets. Basically, sari-sari stores can be found in every barrio, barangay, municipality and city where it has grills or screens for protection against theft. Products here are measured by volumes or by the piece as well.

She has been running the business for twenty (20) years already and this really helped her sustain the needs of her family and support her children’s education as well. The profit that was supposed to be used in buying additional products for the store has been used for their daily needs instead.

To add products for the business, Nida decided to apply for a Php 11,000 loan to be able buy stock like bottled drinks, a variety of grocery items, school supplies and other products to add to the business.

Once every week, Nida regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items, school supplies and other products for the business’ expansion.

loans.name: Mwihoko Tosheka 11 Widows Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Mary, 41 years old and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.

She is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizer in order to improve productivity on her banana farming, hence increasing income.

She hopes the income will improve her living standards by enabling her to pay school fees for her children.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana farm, hence improving productivity to enable her pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Chrisally

texts.en:
Chrisally is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children. To earn a living and to be able to provide for their daily needs, she decided to engage in a palay production businesses. She plants palay and sells it in the market. She delivers it to her loyal customers.

She decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for her palay production so that she can produce a good quality rice and be able to deliver more rice in the market and to her customers that will result in a greater income.

Chrisally's plans for the future are to save money and to improved their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertlizer for palay production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients for making bread to sell

loans.name: Xuraman

texts.en:
Xuraman is 29 years old and married. She is from Agdash. She is a stead and very diligent woman.

Xuraman is a farmer. She started to work in her field four years ago. Xuraman’s monthly income is 767 Azn. She wants to get new fruit trees, to grow different fruits and then sell them on the market.

Xuraman gives importance to human lives, that’s why she grows organic. In addition, in Azerbaijan people prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because they are naturally raised and cheaper.

She wants to purchase new farming equipment, which has more advantages, like being cleaner and safer. This will help her to grow more healthy organic seeds. But, for this, she needs some funds.

With this loan she will purchase more land and sow more seeds. We need Kiva lenders to support Xuraman.

loans.use: to purchase new farming equipment, which has more advantages like being cleaner and safer

loans.name: Santos Concepcion

texts.es: Santos es una mujer de 52 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace 20 años, cuando compro el terreno en el cual con mucho esfuerzo logro construir su vivienda. Santos es una mujer emprendedora que siempre está buscando la manera de salir adelante, es por ello que recorre las calles del municipio ofreciendo su mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, faldas, camisetas, etc. Además buscando obtener mejores ingresos vende productos de belleza por catálogo. Santos con mucho esfuerzo ha ido mejorando su vivienda, ella ha observado que cuando llueve el agua ingresa a su vivienda, por lo que desea ampliar el corredor de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, pines y alambre para ampliar el corredor de su vivienda y de esta manera evitar que el agua ingrese a su vivienda deteriorando sus pertenencias.
texts.en:
Santos is a 52 year old woman. She has lived in a house that is her property for 20 years. Once she bought the land it was a great effort to mange to build her house. Santos is an enterprising woman who is always on the look-out for ways to get ahead. For this reason she covers the streets of her municipality offering her merchandise like pants, blouses, skirts, t-shirt, etc. Looking to obtain more income she also sells beauty products by catalog.

With much effort Santos has made improvements to her house. She has observed that water enters her house when it rains so she wants to extend the veranda on her house. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in laminated sheeting, beams, bolts and wire to expand the veranda of her house. Doing this she will stop the water entering her house damaging her belongings.

loans.use: to invest in laminated sheeting, beams, bolts and wire to expand the veranda of her house to protect it from the rain.

loans.name: Israel Armando

texts.es: La vivienda en la que habita Israel de 33 años de edad es muy humilde pero en ella vive feliz junto a su esposa y su hijo de 3 años de edad, al que siempre busca la manera de brindar lo mejor. Israel es un hombre trabajador y responsable, es por ello que desde hace 5 años que llego a vivir a la comunidad presta sus servicios de seguridad en un hotel de playa de la zona, además su esposa siempre buscando de salir adelante en familia le apoya prestando sus servicios domésticos. Israel desea continuar mejorando el techo de su corredor, ya que con un crédito anterior cambio el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
The house in which 33-year-old Israel lives is very humble, but he lives there happily with his wife and three-year-old son, for whom he always strives to give the best. 

Israel is a hardworking and responsible man, so he has been providing security services to a beach hotel in the zone ever since he came to live in the community five years ago.  In addition, his wife is always looking to help the family get ahead, and she supports him by providing housekeeping services.
 
 Israel wants to continue improving the roof of his home’s outer corridor, as he repaired the roof of his home with a previous loan, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will invest it in galvanized sheeting, wood, nails, and wire in order to repair the roof of his home’s outer corridor as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to repair the roof of his home's outer corridor.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: María es una es una mujer laboriosa y emprendedora de 38 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos, quienes son su mayor motivación para salir adelante en la vida, desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos, solicita por noveno ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM para la compra de perfumes, camisas, pantalones y chores para damas y caballeros, uno de los logros que obtuvo con los créditos anteriores fue la construcción de su vivienda y realizar los pagos a tiempo en la institución, su nuevo proyecto es poner una tiendita donde pueda ofertar mejor sus productos.
texts.en: María is a harworking business woman. She is 38, married with two children, who are her greatest motivation to get ahead in life. She's been selling apparel clothing and cosmetics for seven years. She is asking for her ninth loan with ADIM to buy perfumes, shirts, slacks, shorts, for men and women. One of her major achievents with the help of these loans has been to finish building her home and to make her payments on time. Her new project is to set up a booth where she could better offer her products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, shirts, slacks, shorts, for men and women

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bags and shoes in larger quantity.

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es:
Regina es una señora con 66 años de edad, trabajadora, humilde y llena de vida.
Su labor es recolectar ropa usada y en buen estado para luego revenderla, esta actividad la inicio desde hace poco, después de pasar por una crisis económica bastante dura.
Trabaja dos días a la semana entre 8 y 10 horas.
Para Regina nada ha sido fácil luego de la separación de su esposo, quien era el sostén del hogar.
Su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de comprar una vivienda propia y gozar de una buena salud.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y calzado de segunda pero especialmente para niños y niñas.

Para esto cuenta con el apoyo de la Corporación Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Regina is 66 years old.  She is hard-working, humble and full of life.  Her work is to collect used clothing that is in good condition to later resell.  She began doing this a little while ago after going through a very hard economic crisis.  She works two days a week, between 8 and 10 hours.

For Regina, nothing has been easy since the separation from her husband who was the financial supporter of the home.

Her goal is to continue working until she achieves her dream of buying her own home and enjoying good health.

She is requesting a loan that she will invest in buying second-hand clothing and shoes, especially for boys and girls.  For this she is counting on the help of Corporacion Interactuar and the Kiva contributors.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing and shoes, especially for boys and girls, to sell

loans.name: Renacientes De Ipal Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RENACIENTES DE IPAL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Frncisca ella es soltera y tiene 36 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to “RENACIENTES DE IPAL” community bank. This bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, province of Convención, department of Cusco.
Francisca is one of their members. She is 36, single and she has a son. She works in the fruit plantation business. She has land where she cultivates bananas, coffee, tangerines and oranges. She works from 6am to 5pm. She's been in the business for several years and she's been very successful. Her dream is to be able to expand her land. She is asking for this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.
The members of the groups attached to the photo had their pictures taken after the meeting after asking for permission to be absent due to work-related commitments. 
The rest of the members work selling animals, selling clothes, selling basic items and selling food.
Francisca is thankful to all of those who are part of her dream through these means and she is committed to pay back this loan according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zarefeh

texts.en:
Zarefeh is a 36-years-old married woman from a village near Nablus city. She lives with her husband and one son in a simple house. Her husband works as a construction worker where he gets a low income. Zarefeh has a sewing workshop which has been opened for the past two years. 

She would like to improve her business and expand it in the future, So she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy new sewing machines for her  business. This will increase her income and also her family living conditions. 
Zarefeh appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines for her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a 44-year-old CCT partner from San Miguel Barotac Viejo, Iloilo and is the wife of Randy. Together they have been cultivating and selling fresh vegetables in their area for ten years already.

Growing vegetables is not an easy business, since you need to wake up early, before dawn. The work is constant, day in and day out. There are no weekends off. They also need to deal with nature. Changes in weather like droughts and storms, and also bugs can take out much of what they might have sold; and, there are high prices for fertilizers. Those are the reasons that make their business challenging. However, it is very rewarding for them to see the vegetables grow and be sold to the market.

Growing and selling vegetables really helped them sustain their everyday expenses. However, they still need additional capital, which will really help them in their business’ expansion. With this, Merly decided to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides, since bugs and insects are their biggest struggle aside from storms and drought.

Merly regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience in the business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
A single woman is 35 years old, Eang living in a rural area of Kampong Thom province’s Sandan district. Nowadays, she does rice farm and grows cassava as the main sources of her family’s income. Moreover, she sells grocery items to earn additional income to complement her family’s needs. She has been involved in her businesses for fifteen years. Her daily business income is about 27,000KHR per day and she is able to save around 10,000KHR each day after offsetting her family’s expenses. Her cassava has been destroyed by insects, which allow her to sell it in a very low a price. 

Due to having not enough money to build a private toilet for her family’s use, she is now leading a group of four members will spend her entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine. This is her first time to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She hopes that this loan will help her and her family members to have good health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a 37-years-old married woman from a village near Hebron city. She lives with her husband and three kids in a simple house. Her husband works in a barber shop where he gets a low income. 

Khetam has a sewing business which has been opened for the past three years. She would like to improve her business and expand it in the future, So she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy new sewing machines for her business. This will increase her income and also her family living conditions. 
Khetam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines for her business.

loans.name: Jolman Alexander

texts.es: Jolman de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto de los clientes; el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jolman is 33 years old. He lives in his own house with his domestic partner. He has a workshop of metal structures: he makes doors, balconies, gates, among other things. He has 15 years working in this business and a lot of experience which helps him improve his work every day. He already has many customers who look for him for the quality of his work, for his good prices; but specially because he always does his job to the taste of his customers. He is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy iron, metal, tools, etc. in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es: Doña Aura es una mujer laboriosa de 36 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos por quienes trabaja día a día para sacarlos adelante y darles u futuro mejor, Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes  AVON desde hace nueve  años, una de sus metas es Agrandar el negocio y maximizar sus ganancias, de manera que solicita por doceavo ciclo el financiamiento en la institución, ella ha mostrado ser una persona responsable y puntual con los pagos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de camisas, pantalones y chores para adultos y niños, con los créditos anteriores logró mejorar su vivienda y solventar sus gastos económicos.
texts.en: Aura is a 36-year-old hardworking woman. She has two children and she works day in and day out to provide them with a better future. She's been selling apparel clothing and AVON cosmetics for nine years. One of her goals is to expand her business and maximize her profit. For this reason, she is asking for her twelfth loan with this bank. She has proven that she is responsible and that she can make her payments on time. She is asking for this loan to buy shirts, slacks and shorts for adults and children. With her previoius loans she was able to make home improvements and cover her financial expenses.

loans.use: to buy shirts, slacks and shorts of adults and children

loans.name: Temboni Group

texts.en:
Paulo, who is in his early 40s is married with three children of of whom is still in school and another one is still small.  He has been a carpenter for ten years now.  He works from 09am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Pailo's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy wood, nails, glue, improved on his workshop by putting a shelter and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He is doing great and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to pay schools, to repay the loan, bought a TV set and covered household expenses.  

He will use this loan to buy wood and carpentry equipment for his furniture business.  He dreams of expanding his business.

Paulo will share this loan with his loan group  TEMBONI which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy wood and carpentry equipment for his furniture business,

loans.name: Madinakhon

texts.en:
Madinakhon is a bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1985 and is living in village with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a master. 

She does business at home retailing milk to neighbors. But she decided to start doing business wider. She is planning to buy and resale milk for an extra price. She appealed to IMON for a help. She wants to get a loan and start doing business. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: To buy milk for startup

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new nets and ropes for her husband and having more fish to sell

loans.name: Kaburugi Mugecha Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Catherine, who is thirty-nine years old and a mother of three children. 

Catherine joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to gain skills on how to run and expand her business through Enterprise and Financial Management training. 

Catherine does dairy farming and is taking a Kiva loan to buy animal feed. This will lead to an increase in milk levels hence an increase in income. She hopes a Kiva loan will improve her standard of living through easy provision of food and clothes for her family and also help her to pay school fees for her three children in school.

Catherine is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support, and she promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed for high milk yield to sell and thus pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various vegetable, tomatoes and kiosk stocks such as sugar, soap, cigarette, coffee, tea, and milk.

loans.name: Karla Yahoska

texts.es: Karla es una joven esforzada y muy trabajadora de 20 años de edad, casada y madre de un niño de cuatro años quien es su mayor motivación, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, sandalias  bisuterías desde hace cuatro años, ella ha mostrado ser una joven responsable y cumplida con los pagos y solicita por octava vez el financiamiento en la institución  para la compra de pantalones, blusas, licras y faldas. Con los créditos anteriores logro comprar una refrigeradora y pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karla is an earnest and very hardworking 20 year old young woman. She is married and the mother of one four year old child, who is her greatest motivation.
She has worked selling new clothing, sandals and jewelry for four years. She has shown herself to be a responsible and courteous young woman with making her payments. She is requesting her eighth loan from the institution to buy pants, blouses, tights and skirts. With the previous loans she was able to buy a refrigerator and pay for her studies.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, tights and skirts.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 30,000 in which she bought 1 sack of rice, 3 cases of soft drinks, 3 boxes of canned goods, 2 tray of salted eggs, biscuits and soaps for her sari sari store (general store) and bought used fabric for her rug making business. Up to date her store has more stock in it and more customers buying her groceries items specially rice which increase her income. Also her rug business is flourishing as she continuously supplies the demand of her customers. Amelia was able to pay her loan on time and the revenue helps her with her everyday expenses.
 
Amelia is requesting a re-loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy more boxes of notebooks, pad papers, reams of white bond papers, pencils, erasers, ball pens and other school supplies since the school days are starting. Amelia wanted to maintain her growing business so that she can continuously support the education of her youngest child and also to support their everyday expenses.

loans.use: To buy papers, ballpens, pencils, bond papers, toys, sack of coals, softdrinks, shampoo and noodles as an additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 45 years old with two children, ages 23 and 15 years old. Her husband works in an electronics shop as a repairman.

Evangeline operates their computer shop, where the computers are all secondhand and repaired by her husband. They customized the computers so that customers can put in PHP 1.00 and browse the Internet for one minute (Pisonet). These are very popular with students and other customers in their community because of the affordable price. Evangeline and her husband also accept customizing repairs for other computers, which gains more customers for them from other small computer shop businesses.

Evangeline wanted to expand her business, since it’s schooling days, to grab the opportunity to increase her income. She wanted to rent a shop where they can put their customized computer rentals and employ one helper to operate the computer shop.

Evangeline is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy five units of secondhand computers for customized computer rentals (Pisonet). The loan will enable her to continuously grow her business and help her community through employment and computer services.

Evangeline is hopeful that their business will grow to help them with their expenses, her youngest child’s education, and to save up for unplanned events.

loans.use: to buy five units of secondhand computers for computer rentals.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is living in a small town with hospitable residents around. She is single and lives with her parents. She is responsible, hardworking and generous person. After graduation from high school she started to work in agriculture. She helps collective farms in their locations. 

As she works hard in bad conditions she got sick. She tested herself at a medical clinic and doctors are saying to go to hospital to get the course of treatment. But she has no money to pay for medicines and the hospital. At the same time she needs to be treated. She appealed to IMON and asked a loan to her treatment at hospital. She hopes Kiva lenders will be kind and support her. She awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to get her treatment at hospital

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius is 28 years old, single with two children.

He is into brick making business as his primary business and has been supplying the bricks to building sites. He also does tea farming and it has been profitable. He will use the loan to buy firewood for use when burning the bricks in the kiln and hopes this will enable him to supply more bricks to building sites and make more income.

He will use the profits to expand his business and pay school fees for his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy firewood for use when burning the bricks in the kiln and hopes this will enable him to supply more bricks to building sites and make more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets (swine), feed and also food (rice) for their consumption.

loans.name: Althea

texts.en:
The term sari-sari store refers to a business found in the Philippines which means “variety”. Most Filipinos prefer to have this type of business since it can be managed from the comfort of their own home while earning money and still be with their family. That’s why Althea, a 53-year-old business woman, the wife of Leonardo from Barotac Viejo Iloilo and one of the CCT partners since 2007, established her own sari-sari store. She started it in the year 1975 and has continually managed the business. Althea dreams to have her store expanded to have a wide array of product choices. She is still formulating ways and marketing strategies for the business’ success since this really helped her sustain their daily expenses and other basic needs.

Althea believes that CCT will help her fulfill her dream for the store’s expansion someday, so she decided to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan that will really help her buy supplies like bottled drinks, a variety of grocery items, school supplies and other products to add to her business. 

On a weekly basis, Althea regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items, school supplies and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for sacks of rice and grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Katia Carolina

texts.es:
Katia siempre quiso apoyar la economia de su hogar, pero como sus hijos eran pequeños se le hacía difícil iniciar a trabajar, por eso comenzó a ahorrar algo del dinero que su esposo le proporcionaba para la alimentación. Con el tiempo, inició a vender verduras y rápidamente evolucionó a una pulpería.
Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar, golosinas, granos básicos, gaseosas, verduras, salsa de tomate, sopas instantáneas y demás productos. Esto le servirá porque podrá ofrecer variedad y así aumentaran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Katia always wanted to contribute economic support to the home, but as her children were small, it made it difficult to begin to work, so she started to save some of the money that her husband had provided her for food.  With time, she began to sell vegetables and this rapidly developed into a small grocery store. 

Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy snacks, staple foods, soda pop, vegetables, tomato sauce, instant soups and other products.  This will be useful because she will be able to offer variety and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy snacks, staple foods, soda pop, vegetables, tomato sauce, instant soups and other products.

loans.name: Doina

texts.en:
Doina  is a farmer from Zazulenii Vechi village, Ungheni region in Moldova. She owns a small land where she grows crops for her cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. At the same time she is a greengrocer and have been managing her farm for 7 years, producing cows, sheep cheese, wool and vegetables that she sells locally. Doina is a loving mother of 3 years and 6 years old boys. Her husband is an occasional builder and helps Doina in managing this farm. 

This hard-working farmer wants to develop her business around the sheep, pigs, cows and chickens that she owns and to be able to meet her family’s needs and be self-reliant.
Doina will use the loan to build a new stable for animals and extend by this mean her farm's capacities.

loans.use: to build a new stable for animals

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret is 50 years old living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district. She is a mother of five children, only one of whom is in school. Nowadays, she does rice farm and sells cucumbers. She has been involved in these businesses for thirty-two years. Because of drought so her crops grow not well and it cause her to have not enough money to do farming for this season. 

Because of this case, she decides to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of four members will use her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice-paddy fields. She hopes that this loan will help her to get more income to upgrade her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice-paddy fields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Solidario Marta De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Solidario Marta de Vista hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Marta Julia quien se dedica a la confección y venta de blusas de tela por docenas en diferentes tallas, calidad, diseño y precios. Entrega en tres tiendas y su sueño es ser una gran distribuidora en varios mercados y trabajar ropa de excelencia. Su esposo la apoya en todo y al lado de sus hijitos, lucha a cada amanecer para ofrecerles algo mejor. Tiene varios pedidos de blusas, pero la tela que tiene no le alcanza por tal motivo necesita un préstamo para poder comprar más tela y no quedarle mal a sus compradores con sus pedidos.
texts.en: This is the Solidario Marta de Vista hermosa group. Marta Julia is in charge of the group and she makes and sells blouses in bulk in different sizes, quality, designs and prices. She delivers products to three stores and her dream is to become a large distribuitor in several markets and to work a high-end clothing line. Her husband supports her fully as well as her children. She works every day to offer them a better future. She has several orders for blouses, but she doesn't have enough fabric, so she needs a loan to buy more fabric rather than disappoint her buyers with their orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make garments for sale

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo lives at Amulung. She is 38 years old, married and has two children. To sustain her family's daily needs for food and school allowances, she sells different commodities for income. 

She wanted to continue selling good products but had insufficient fund to maintain her business. She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, soap, shampoo and noodles to sell. Selling more merchandise will help her gain more profits in return. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, shampoo and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Santos Feliciano

texts.es:
Santos Feliciano tiene 68 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge sin hijos a su cargo en casa propia de material rústico en el caserío de Huancas, del distrito de Querocotillo que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Santos se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Santos espera ofrecer un arroz de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Feliciano is 68 years old. He lives with his wife and does not have any children in his care. They live in their own home made of rustic materials in the small village of Huancas, in the district of Querocotillo, which is located in the province of Cutervo, in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in this district is peaceful and the inhabitants work primarily in agriculture, retail and ranching. 
Santos works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of rice. He has 15 years of experience and very good personal and work references in the area. The loan that he will receive will be used to buy fertilizer to adequately maintain his cultivation of rice and hire manual labourers for the harvesting season. With this, Santos hopes to offer better quality rice to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level and consequently improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire manual labourers for the harvesting season.

loans.name: Serchin

texts.en:
Serchin learned Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Serchin feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to her business. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Serchin wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Sokhen's Group

texts.en:
Sokhen is a 49-year-old woman living in a remote area of Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Sokhen is the mother of three children. She does rice farming as the main source of her family’s income, and she sometimes raises chicken and duck to support her living conditions. She has been involved in these businesses for thirty-one years. 

The crops were destroyed by insects and caused her to not have enough funds to do farming for this season. Now she decided to lead a group to apply for a new loan to solve this problem. For Sokhen, she has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. As the group leader of five members, she will ask for a new loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crops well. She hopes her farm will gain her higher yields than the previous year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crops well.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ma. Monserrat

texts.en:
Ma. Monserrat is very thankful to KIVA for the loan granted to her in the amount of 30,000  PHP, which she used to buy frozen food (sausages, hot dogs, pork and ham) for sale to her neighbors. Together with her store more customers are patronizing her because there are more stocks to find in her store compared to other stores in their community. Ma. Monserrat was able to repay her loan on time and she was able to buy a new coffee vending machine, which she used in her store. She was also able to continuously support her child's education and help support her everyday expenses.

Ma. Monserrat is now requesting a new loan amounting to 30,000 PHP to buy more frozen food (sausages, hot dogs, pork and ham) because more customers are demanding these goods. Ma. Monserrat wants to maintain her growing store to help finance her child's education, and to save up in case of unplanned events.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food such as sausages, hotdogs, pork and ham to sell in her store as demanded by customers

loans.name: Young Heart Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Margaret, thirty nine years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to gain skills on record keeping and know how to manage her enterprise. The training has enabled her to improve her business.
She is a poultry farmer which enables her to earn a living. 

She is taking a Kiva loan to add stock of chicks and buy chick mash for high production of eggs hence increase in income. She hopes this will enable her cater for her family’s basic needs and pay school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy additional chicks and also chicken feed to improve production and enable her to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old, single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, a few years ago, Mohammad started his own business. He manages and operates a stall for selling shoes.

This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new collection of children's and women's shoes for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of children's and women's shoes for his stall

loans.name: Turana

texts.en:
Turana is 29 years old, married, and from Agdas, Azerbaijan. She is a teacher, and she started her work 9 years ago. Turana is not happy because she does not earn enough to support her family. 

She wants Kiva's support because her husband is ill and needs treatment and medicines. Kiva lenders should show to her compassion and support.

loans.use: purchase treatment and medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy noodles, coffee, powdered milk, toiletries, chips, candies, canned goods, soft drinks, and drinking liquor

loans.name: Roxana Carolina

texts.es: Roxana de 23 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y su hijo de 1 años de edad.  Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas como: faldas, blusas, ropa interior, etc., negocio con el que genera sus ingresos y le permite llevar todos los insumos básicos a su hogar, además recibe el apoyo del esposo quien le ayuda con algunos gastos del hogar y juntos mantienen la economía del mismo.  Roxana desea construir un muro alrededor de su vivienda además poner un portón para brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, ángulo, portón, etc., para si mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roxana is 23 years old.  She lives with her husband and 1 year old child in a home they own.  She is a very hard worker who makes her living selling clothing for women such as skirts, blouses, underwear, etc.  She generates her income through this business which allows her to provide all the basic supplies to her home.  She also receives support from her husband who helps with some of the household expenses.  Together they maintain the finances of their home.  

Roxana wants to construct a wall around her house and install a gate to provide more security for her family.  For that reason she seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, sand, angle iron, a gate, etc. to improve her home.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, angle iron, a gate, etc. to improve her home.

loans.name: Giorgi Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Giorgi está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, coordinado por Xiomara de 22 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos quienes son su mayor motivación, ella es una joven laboriosa propietaria de una pulpería desde hace dos años donde ofrece una variedad de productos a sus clientes, solicita por segunda vez el crédito en Adim para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, gaseosa y leche. Una de sus metas es desarrollar el negocio, la segunda socia es Maybelline de 20 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, la tercer socia es Rebeca de 23 años quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Giorgi" is formed by three entrepreneurial women and is coordinated by Xiomara. She is 22 years old, single, and the mother of two children who are her great motivation. She is a hard-working young woman, and for two years she has been the proprietor of a grocery store where she offers a variety of products to her customers. She is applying for a loan from ADIM for the second time in order to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, soft drinks, and milk. One of her goals is to develop the business.

The second member is Maybelline, who is 20 years old and sells used clothing. The third member is Rebeca, who is 23 years old and sells tortillas.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, soft drinks, and milk for her store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
"I just want to see my children wearing their togas in their graduation from college someday. If that happens, I'll be more than satisfied. My hard work will have paid off," said Josephine. 

Josephine is a mother to two kids who are both in elementary school. She is married to Cancio, and they live in Manila. She owns a "sari-sari" (variety) store business where she earns income for their family's living. 

In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. Sari-sari stores sell different kinds of products, such as biscuits, candies, canned goods, noodles, personal hygiene products, and the like, which are involved in every individual’s daily living. This is one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people because it provides commodities for people. 

Josephine wants to request a loan. She wants to have additional capital for buying more merchandise. It would be better because it's easier to respond to customers' demands when there are more items displayed in the store. She needs 13,000 PHP. 

She really hopes that you will give her this chance. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Abadahemuka A Group

texts.en:
Angelique is a group leader and is 50 years old. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 15 and 29 years. The group is called ABADAHEMUKA, which means “TRUSTED PEOPLE” in English. 

They sell different products and they wish to expand their business in order to better their future. Angelique sells clothes and has been running the business for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more t-shirts and trousers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Saybibi

texts.en:
Saybibi was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in remote district with her family. She is widow and has four children. She has 20 years of practice serving people with tasty and sweet cakes and pastries. She bakes “Bulochka”, cakes and cookies. Beside it she does business of retailing water to stores. She works hard and year by year she gets older and tired. 

She wants to get course of treatment at medical clinic. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking financial support to get treatment at hospital.

loans.use: to get treatment at hospital

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a careful grandma. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is living in a small town with her son. She is a widow and has two children. 

Galina is also a baby-sitter. She takes care of children under seven and teaches them elementary knowledge. She is well-known among friends and students who seek to participate in her classes and be a part of her story tales. 

Galina's granddaughter is sick. Galina wants to treat her in a medical clinic. She appealed to IMON to get a loan to pay for her granddaughter’s treatment at the hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits the kindness of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her granddaughter’s treatment at the hospital

loans.name: Mirna Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mirna es una microempresaria exitosa de 56 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatro hijos quienes gracias a sus esfuerzos son independientes, durante 20 años ella ha administrado con ayuda de su esposo el negocio que es la comercialización de ropa, perfumes y bisutería. Solicita por octavo ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de blusas, pantalones, talladores y ropa interior, con los créditos anteriores logro mejorar y ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Mirna is a 56-year-old successful micro-entrepreneur. She is married and a mother of four children who, through her efforts, are independent. For 20 years, she has managed a business with the help of her husband which is the sale of clothing, perfume, and jewelry. 

For her eighth loan cycle, Mirna is requesting the loan in the institution for the purchase of blouses, pants, body shapers, and underwear. With the previous loans, she got to improve and expand her house.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, body shapers, and underwear.

loans.name: Karina Marlene

texts.es: Karina es una mujer laboriosa de 28 años de edad, soltera y madre de un niño quien es su mayor deseo de superación, ella es propietaria de una pulpería donde oferta variedad de productos a los clientes desde hace dos años, solicita por segundo ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y jabón. Con el crédito anterior logro comprar un frízer y resolver los gastos económicos de su hijo, así mismo pagar a tiempo las cuotas establecidas con la institución.
texts.en: Karina is a 28-year-old hardworking woman. She is single and she has a son, who is her greatest motivation. She's owned a grocery store for two years, where she offers a large variety of products to her customers. She is asking for a loan with ADIM to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil and soap. With her previous loan she was able to buy a freezer and cover her son's financial expenses, at the same time as she repaid her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil and soap.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en: Mary Cris landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC rescued Mary Cris by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Mary Cris perserveres and always believes that she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Edia

texts.en: Edia is 61 years old, a widow, and lives in Polangyuta, Larena, Siquijor. She is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Floresita Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Florecita está coordinado por tres mujeres laboriosas, coordinado por Mariela una mujer luchadora de 33 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos quienes son su mayor motivación, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y bisutería desde hace tres años, solicita por segundo ciclo el financiamiento en la institución, porque desea ofertar a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos y de esta manera desarrollar el negocio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pantalones, camisas,  camisolines y calcetas. Con el crédito anterior logró  comprar una vitrina. La segunda socia es Yosmara de 25 años  quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y comida y la tercer socia es María de 34 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Florecita is formed by three industrious women and is coordinated by Mariela, a hard-working woman of 33. She is a single mother of three children who are her great motivation. She has been selling new clothing and costume jewelry for three years. She is applying for a second round of financing with the institution because she wants to offer her customers a greater variety of products and in this way develop the business. The loan that she is applying for is for the purchase of pants, shirts, tank tops, and socks. With the previous loan, she succeeded in buying a display case.

The second member is Yosmara, age 25, who sells clothing and food, and the third member is Maria, age 34, who sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, tank tops, and socks to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in this photo is Margaret a 55 year old lady, married and a mother of 5 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2012 and has been trained on enterprise development and financial management by HiH EA.

Margaret practices mixed farming of maize, beans, bananas, avocados and coffee as her major enterprise. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve her farm produce and so be able to pay for her basic needs like food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan in good time.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve production and thus be able to buy basic items such as. food and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and have milk to sell to make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
Anie is only 19 years old, single and comes from GMA, Cavite, Philippines. As with majority of Filipinos, Anie's family struggle to make ends meet. Anie being the eldest had to stop schooling to help her mother make a living and gave way to her younger siblings to attend school.

Anie developed her love for food and cooking as she witnessed and enjoyed her mother's talent for cooking. She was trained by her mother to cook dishes as she was growing up. Her regular customers are her neighbors within her community who at her eatery before they report for work or even after work to bring home to their families. 

To help the young lady operate her eatery she is requesting a Php 40000 loan to buy ingredients needed to cook dishes to serve to her customers. She is thanking you in advance for your good heart and the financial aid that will be given her for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance and send her younger siblings to school.

Anie wants to focus on her eatery business and make it grow into a restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.
