loans.use: To buy fresh chicken, pork, veggies, seasonings to cook dishes for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: do repairs and maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquín  tiene 65 años de edad habita en vivienda propia y humilde construida de bajareque  el cual tiene varios años de habitarla, junto con su esposa y sus 2 hijas de 19 y 22 años de edad  e hijo varón de 17 años de edad. Joaquín presta sus servicios de albañil en la comunidad y  también  presta sus servicios de jornalero realizando oficios varios por las tardes con lo cual le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar, es muy reconocido por sus vecinos como un hombre honesto y trabajador. Joaquín  está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, cemento, inodoro de lavar, hierro y otros materiales para la construcción de una fosa séptica  y de esta manera poder brindar a su familia una mayor higiene, el espera contar con dicho crédito ya que desea que la mejora se realice lo mas antes posible y así poder brindarle ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Joaquin, 65, lives in his own humble home made of daub and wattle.   He has lived there for a number of years with his wife and their 2 daughters aged 19 and 22 and their 17 year-old son.  Joaquin works in construction in the community, and he also works as a dayworker doing a variety of tasks in the afternoons.  This is how he has been able to support the household finances.  Joaquin is well known by his neighbors for being an honest and hardworking man. 

Joaquin is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system so that he can provide his family with better hygiene.  He hopes to be able to rely on this loan, because he wants to do this project as soon as possible so that he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a septic system

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animals (chickens) and feed for them in order to [later] sell them

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 23-year-old, single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, A few years ago, Omar started his own business where he manages a stall for selling fruit and vegetable

This is the only source of income for the family. Omar took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy fruit and vegetable for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. Omar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetable for his stall.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
Munavvar was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in village with her family. She is widow and a business woman, retailing vegetables and fruits. She retails at domestic market and has permanent customers. She is satisfied to have an activity that helps her family be ensured. 

She feels bad and wants to get treatment to be recovered. She appealed to IMON asking a loan to get the course of treatment at medical clinic. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to get the course of treatment at medical clinic

loans.name: Frieda

texts.en:
Frieda is a 47-year-old resident of Pasay, Philippines and she is married to Isidro. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They work hard for their children and to provide income for their everyday needs.

Frieda maintains a charcoal business with her partner's help as well. She buys a huge quantity of charcoal and then repacks it to sell in a retail business. Usually, she sells each bag at PHP 5 to PHP 10 depending on the size. With this inventory, she is able to support the expenses of her household. However, it becomes hard for her when her husband doesn't have the time to buy charcoal for her.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of charcoal to sell.

Frieda dreams of expanding her business more and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She is also praying to have an additional source of income someday like buying a jeepney so when her husband retires, he could still drive and earn a living.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old, married and has six children. Her family lives at Amulung. 

Erlinda is managing a store and she sells different merchandise to generate income. She is now asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy grocery items to put up in her store to sell. She will buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help increase her sales capacity. She hopes to save money to cover her family's emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Nakham Group

texts.en:
Mai is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  
Mai and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Mai and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Mai and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Mai and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Sub Group C

texts.en:
Enodiya is a group leader. She is 37 years old, married, and she has 4 children between the ages of 7 and 18 years. Her group is called ABADAHEMUKA which means “TRUSTED PEOPLE” in English. 

The group members sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their futures for the better. Enodiya owns a shop and has been running the business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to buy medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 30 years old, married to Mark Anthony and they have two children. 

Michelle became an entrepreneur years ago. She currently handles a direct-selling business. She started with a small capital buying her first products. Because of her steadfast determination, she has now earned the trust of her customers. Although there are times that she struggles when there are delayed payments, she still works hard because she believes that such situations are an inevitable part of handling a business.

She sells different kinds of products, mostly personal product such as soaps, lotion, perfumes and the like. The profit she gets from the business becomes a great help for their family in terms of their daily expenses. 

Michelle is a typical mother with a typical dream for her children. There is nothing more that she hopes for than for her children to gain a better quality of education and to have college degrees. 

This is the reason that Michelle wants to further improve her resources. If you would allow, she wants to ask for a 15,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more products to sell. With this, she can surely gain more income; part of which will be saved for future investments and part of which will be used for their everyday living.  

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. 

Michelle meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn, a thirty-four year old fish vendor from San Juan, Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, is the wife of Rodel, a fisherman. Together they work hand-in-hand to run their business which they just started last year in 2014. Being a fisherman is not an easy task. Rodel’s day begins at dawn when it is still chilly and dark. When he is in the middle of the sea, he begins to let down his net hoping for a good catch. Now and then he pulls his net into the boat. Sometimes the net is loaded with fish, prawns and crabs, but at other times, the net is empty. When Rodel reaches the shore, Roselyn helps him sort out the fish and prawns which are of different types and sizes. After sorting the catch, Roselyn takes them to the market to be sold.

At times, the catch is not enough. To help sustain the business, Roselyn would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan. She will use that amount to buy materials needed for the repair and maintenance of their pumpboat. A portion of the loan will also be used to purchase fish products which she will sell in addition to the fish and prawns that her husband will catch.

Eventually, Roselyn and Rodel are planning to acquire an additional pumpboat. Also, they are planning to add dried fishes for their customers to have a variety of fish products to choose from. Roselyn and Rodel have one child. They dream that through their hard work and dedication to their business, they will be able to sustain their child’s needs in school and will later become a professional.

Roselyn regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. All CCT Community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase pumpboat materials, other fishing materials and various fish products.

loans.name: Mery Raquel

texts.es:
Mery, de 45 años de edad, es una persona muy dedicada a su familia, vende tortillas, no tuvo la oportunidad de completar sus estudios, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.

Mery, tiene 15 años de experiencia vendiendo tortillas y tamales, esta actividad la aprendió de su abuela y de su madre, quien dedicó toda su vida a la venta de tortillas en su comunidad, una de sus hijas le ayuda todos los días por las mañanas para salir a vender y en la tarde se dedica a estudiar.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar una plancha nueva más grande para hacer tortillas, comprar maíz y productos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos. 

Los sueños de Mery, son establecer su negocio de manera formal y construir instalaciones más adecuadas para la venta de desayunos y almuerzos.
texts.en:
Mery is 45 years old and is very devoted to her family.  She sells tortillas.  She did not have the opportunity to complete her schooling.  She is married with three children.

Mery has 15 years experience selling tortillas and tamales.  She learned this business from her grandmother and mother, who also made their living selling tortillas in the community.  One of her daughters helps her every day in the morning by going out and selling, while in the afternoon she spends her time studying.

The money from the loan will be used to buy a new, larger griddle to make tortillas, and to buy corn and other agricultural products to plant basic grains.

Mery's dreams are to establish her business in a more permanent manner and to build more suitable premises from which she can sell breakfasts and lunches.

loans.use: to buy a new and bigger griddle for making tortillas, and to buy corn and agricultural products to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Wendi Witu Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Ester, who is forty-three years old and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 in order to gain skills in running and managing her business. 

Ester is a dairy and cereal farmer and also sells bananas.

Ester is applying for a Kiva loan to add stock of bananas for more income through increased sales. She hopes a Kiva loan will improve her living standards by enabling her to pay the school fees for her children.

Ester promises to pay her loan promptly and is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy stock of bananas to sell and therefore increase her income to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Lorohuachana Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOROHUACHANA AL PROGRESO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth Mary, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua cultivando  plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y abono.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de ganadería.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Los socios que salen adjuntos  a la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the community bank “Lorohuachana al Progreso”. This bank is located in the Quellouno district, and belongs to the Convención province in the department of Cusco.

One member is Ruth Mary, who continues working in the business of growing fruit. She is a responsible and diligent person.

She continues to grow bananas, coffee, mandarins, and oranges to later sell to her customers who request them. She wants to be able to continue working, in order to keep supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

The other group members work in the businesses of animal sales, agriculture, a grocery store, and raising livestock.

Ruth Mary is grateful to Kiva lenders who form a part of her dream, and she commits to following the established repayment schedule.

The members attached to the main photo received permission to arrive late to the meeting, due to work obligations.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is currently handling and managing a food stall business today.  She is already 55 years old by now and live at Intramuros City. 

With her full-blown potential in business handling, she is confident enough to borrow a loan worth PHP 50,000 which she will use to buy additional ingredients and raw products for her business. With her twelve years from this industry, she assures you to repay faithfully with all that she can. 

Today, she is really striving enough to save money for her family though sometimes she really feels tired of working. But, giving up is not a word for her when she knows she wants to really bring her family into a more convenient way of living in the future. At the same time, she's looking forward for the success of her business. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and raw products for her food stall business.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Raising four kids alone is not easy, especially to a widow like Cynthia, 48, from the city of Taguig. 

It was painful at first when she lost her husband, her heart crushed and mind blew. But later on, she realized and accepted the fact that life must go on for her young ones. She still wants to see them someday graduate on their college degrees and get professional jobs too. With that in mind now, she is facing life with full determination, aiming to give her children better lives ahead despite her apparent situation. 

Currently, she has been handling a parlor shop where she uses her expertise in the beauty industry to serve and make money for her family. She earns just enough from here but there are times when there only few customers visit her shop, thus, accumulates her only a small amount of profit. She became a member of CCT recently. With the guide of this group of companies, she was able to find effective and strategic ways on how to handle her business efficiently. 

Now, she comes to Kiva to ask for a loan that she would utilize to buy more materials needed in her parlor shop. With new and effective equipments and materials, she will be able to intensify the quality of service she is offering, which for sure will satisfy more her customers. 

With an amount of PHP 30,000, you can now help her realize her aim of a better salon. 

She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: for buying more materials and equipments needed in her parlor shop.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón, de 48 años de edad, es un campesino muy trabajador y luchador, desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, comienza su tarea y al caer el sol, regresar a casa donde su compañera de vida le espera para atenderle como se merece, juntos crecieron a 9 hijos, de los cuales 7 ya tienen sus propias familias.

Ramón, desde pequeño trabaja la tierra con mucho afán y esmero, su padre le enseño el oficio de la agricultura y él lo ha representado muy dignamente en donde quiera que lo buscan para trabajar.

Ramón, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar, porque ya está por comenzar el tiempo idóneo para preparar la tierra para cultivarla. 

Ramón, desea seguir trabajando la tierra, pues le gusta mucho su trabajo y es de ahí de donde obtiene él y su familia el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Ramón, who is 48 years old, is a very hard-working and striving farmer. He begins his work from the very early hours of the morning, and at the setting of the sun he returns to his house, where his life companion awaits him to look after him as he deserves. Together they raised nine children, of whom seven already have their own families.

Ever since he was small, Ramon has worked the land with much effort and care. His father taught him agricultural work, and he has represented him with great dignity wherever they have sought him to work.

Ramón needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies in order to plant, because the ideal time for preparing the land for cultivation is already beginning.

Ramón wants to continue working the land, since he likes his work a lot, and it is from this [work] that he and his family obtain daily sustenance.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to plant, because the ideal time for preparing the land for cultivation is already beginning.

loans.name: Lourlyn

texts.en:
Lourlyn is 45 years old, married with two children.

Lourlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, candies, snack foods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Lourlyn has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lourlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, candies, snack foods, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Thom province, Pheap is 34-year-old and she is a mother of a small child. She does rice farming, grows cassava and cashew as the main sources of her family’s income. Sometimes, she works on her co-villager’s farm for a fee to earn more income to support her living standard. She has been involved in her job for fifteen years and she is able to earn income about 25,000KHR per day and save around 10,000KHR each day. Insects have destroyed her crops so to sell in a low price, which is the problem for her business. 

Pheap has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the first loan cycle for her. She is the leader of her group of five members; she will manage her loan portion to buy a decent latrine for her family’s uses. She hopes that this loan will help her and her family members to be healthy so to have better house to stay than before.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for her family’s uses.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn is a local resident living in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Vorn is 41 years old and she is the mother of one child. The main source of her family’s income comes from rice farming. Sometimes, she sells cucumbers to earn more income to support her family’s living. She has been involved in this business for twenty-three years. 

The price of fertilizer is increasing, which is the main challenge for her rice farming business. Because she is lacking funds, she decided to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund and this is her first loan. Her group contains six members and she is willing to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide for her farmland to increase the productivity of her crop yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income so she can improve her family's condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide for her farmland and increase the productivity of her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. Ella solicita un préstamo de ₡ 570 000 para la compra de materia prima para continuar realizando esta actividad, de la cual dependen los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en: Ana Cecilia makes a living as a seamstress. She is requesting a loan of ₡ 570 000 to buy raw material. This will help her continue working in this business, on which her family's income depends.

loans.use: to buy material to make clothing

loans.name: Raufjon

texts.en:
Raufjon was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1988. He is married and has two children.  His work is not permanent, as he gets orders to renovate and repair houses and rooms. He has four year practice at serving group of construction. He tries his best and works hard. 

His mother is sick and he needs to have treated her in hospital. He appealed to IMON and asked a loan to pay for his mother's treatment in a medical clinic. He hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat his mother in hospital

loans.name: Franklin Uriel

texts.es:
Franklin es un joven emprendedor, que decidió iniciar su propio negocio, él tiene una tienda de venta de accesorios para celulares y películas en Dvd. Poco a poco ha logrado surtirse de lo último en carcasas para celures, cargadores, auriculares, entre otras cosas, que su clientela solicita. 
Para seguir surtiendo su negocio Franklin solicita, un préstamo, para utilizarlo en comprar, juegos para distintas consolas de videojuegos, nuevos accesorios para celulares y películas en Dvd. En un futuro planea poder seguir contando con financiamientos de Kiva y MiCrédito, y poder ofrecer en su local celulares y computadoras.
texts.en:
Franklin is a young entrepreneur who decided to start his own business. He has a store that sells cell phone accessories and movies on DVD. Little by little, he has succeeded in stocking the latest in phone cases, chargers, and earphones, among other things that his clientele looks for.

In order to continue stocking his business, Franklin is requesting a loan to buy games for various video game consoles, new cell phone accessories, and movies on DVD.

In the future, he plans to continue using loans from Kiva and MiCrédito, and to be able to offer cellphones and computers in his area.

loans.use: to buy games for various video game consoles, new cell phone accessories, and movies on DVD

loans.name: Brayer Alexander

texts.es:
Brayer tiene 21 años de edad, soltero sin hijos a su cargo, en el caserío Mamaca, en el distrito de San Felipe que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaen, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Brayer se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo, con esto Brayer espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Brayer is 21 years old. He is single and not responsible for any children. He lives in the hamlet of Mamaca, in the district of San Felipe, which is located in the province of Jaen, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in the community is peaceful. The people work principally in commerce and raising small animals.

Brayer offers transportation services to people in his vehicle. He has experience in this area and very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan will be used to do repairs and maintenance on his vehicle. With this, Brayer hopes to offer better service to his customers, which will generate better income for him and in the end improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and has four children. His husband is a motorcycle driver. She aims to improve the kind of living she has, so she decided to make her own products to sell, like coated and uncoated peanuts, tagactac, and other kinds of peanuts she makes. She also buys and sells beverages to her customers. She wants to earn more so she decided to borrow a loan for the additional capital for the ingredients needed in her products.
 
Gemma’s plan for her future is to save money to sustain her family's daily needs and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for making her own food products to sell

loans.name: Korn's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a remote area of Kampong Thom province’s Sandan district, Korn is a 34-year-old mother of two dependent children who are both in school. Nowadays, she does rice farming and raises pigs as the main sources of her family’s income. She distills alcohol to earn additional income to complement her family’s needs. She has been involved in her job for fifteen years. Flooded crops and her pigs not growing well are the problems she has in running her business.

For Korn, she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully.The previous loan has helped her to have enough for her family to consume. She is now leading a group of three members to apply for a new Kiva loan. As the leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine to improve her family’s living. She hopes that this loan will help her family to have a better standard of living and all her family members will have good health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine to improve her family’s living.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Here is Mercy and she's asking for a loan that means a lot for her business expansion today.

Taking a small peek at her background, she wasn't able to finish her schooling. She only graduated from elementary school and then eventually stopped going to school because of some factors. But that never became a hindrance to move forward and reach her dreams. She is already 39 years old now and with her self-will and courage, she's making herself quite busy now in handling her buy-and-sell business.

As you can see in the picture, she offers different kinds of bags and sells them at an affordable price. From here, she gets income that serves as a remedy for her family's seemingly unending financial incapacity.

At times, there are cases where her sales never meet her expectations. It's really hard when such moments like these come. There are also circumstances when her capital is not enough. And being one of the breadwinners of the family, she doesn't want this business to just end with just an unreasonable cause--insufficiency.

She believes that there is always a provision when there is a vision (a dream). This inspiration comes from the people around her who encourage her, including the people that she interacts with every week in a regular fellowship*. Here, they share, testify and study the word of God.

Prove to her that what she believes is always true. She's asking now for a loan worth 40,000 pesos that she would use to purchase additional bags for her inventory to sell. It's just one small step for you to take to help Mercy.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags for her inventory to sell.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Serah, thirty-two years old and a mother of two children. She has undergone training through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa that has enabled her to manage her enterprise. She sells clothes to earn her living.

She is borrowing a loan to add more clothes, which will enable her to earn more income and be in a position to pay school fees for her children.

Serah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and increase her profit to support the education of her children.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 50-year-old, widowed woman. She has two children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business.

She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells it to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

Naseem expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 43 years old and married with three children. 

A rice mill is the only thing that they have in order for them to earn and to be able to provide their daily needs. With the help of her husband, who will be the one who helps Roselyn to operate this machine, she decided to take a loan to repair and maintain her rice mill machine so that they can operate their business again.

Roselyn’s plan for her future is to save money to sustain their daily needs and to educate her children.

loans.use: to repair her rice mill

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 37 years old, married and has three young children. 

To gain income, Yolanda raises hogs to sell. She has been in her business for about two years now. She gains an unstable income, so she also sells vegetables as an additional source of income. 

Yolanda would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and rice bran for her hogs' sustenance. She would like to improve her hogs' growth so that she can sell them at a higher cost someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice bran for her hogs' sustenance

loans.name: Jose Isidoro

texts.es:
José, es agricultor desde hace muchos años, está acompañado y en su casa solo viven 2 hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, su compañera de vida y sus hijos han trabajado de la mano con él desde siempre.

José, es agricultor desde muy temprana edad, toda su vida la dedica al trabajo en el campo, ahora que sus hijos son adolescente y tienen más energía que él, le ayudan con las labores y la labranza de la tierra.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar granos básicos, porque se acerca el tiempo idóneo para hacerlo y quiere estar preparado.

José, desea que sus hijos se superen mucho más de lo que él pudo lograr y que sean jóvenes de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en: Jose has been a farmer for many years. He has a domestic partner. Only two of his children, 13 and 15 years old, still live at home. His domestic partner and his children have always worked with him. Jose has been a farmer since very young. All his life, he has worked in the fields. Now that his children are teenagers and have more energy than him, they help him with his job and with sowing the soil. Jose needs a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, pesticides and herbicides to grow basic grains, because the ideal time for doing so is approaching and he wants to be prepared. Jose wishes that his children progress much more than him, and that they are good young people for the well being of society.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, pesticides and herbicides to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
“Having a good customer relationship is a key to success.” This is what Regina, a fifty-four year old widow from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, firmly believes. Regina runs a small convenience store which has been operating for thirty long and fruitful years. In her community, small convenience stores are elsewhere thus creating a stiff competition. It serves an advantage that her store is one of the pioneering stores wherein she is able to establish patrons. The challenge is how she will maintain her customers and attract new customers as well. With this, she makes sure that her store will continuously give what the customers need and her products are of competitive and affordable prices.

It is her utmost desire to offer her customers with the products that they are looking for wherein her store can become a “one-stop shop”. With this goal, Regina would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan to help her provide a wide array of products for her business. She will use this amount to purchase additional bottled products, toiletries, condiments and grocery items. 

With the profits being generated from her business, she became God’s extension of blessing in supporting her family needs and in helping others as well. Being a High School undergraduate, she dreams that her children and grandchildren will graduate from college and eventually become professionals and excel in their chosen careers.

Regina is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

All CCT Community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock such as bottled products, toiletries, condiments and grocery items

loans.name: Dúo Chajones De San Juan Sac Group

texts.es:
Dúo Chajones de San Juan Sac
Este dúo formado por doña Gloria Florencia,  quien es la líder del dúo, nos cuenta que tiene 4 hijos, es casada y desde hace 8 años, se dedica a la venta de artículos de consumo diario como( arroz, frijol, maíz, azúcar, aguas, golosinas, pan,) etc. Ella está solicitando este crédito para su tienda comprando más productos para su tienda que por falta de capital no puede comprar bastante y como da al crédito por semana le vienen a pagar entonces necesita capital para seguir vendiendo.
texts.en: This group was started by Gloria Florencia, who is the leader of the group. She says that she has four children, that she is married, and that she has been making a living by selling staple products (such as rice, beans, maize, sugar, water, lollies, and bread) for the last eight years. She is requesting this loan so she can buy more products for her store. Due to a lack of capital, she is not able to buy enough stock. Since she extends weekly credit for her store she needs capital in order to continue selling stock.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario ríos de agua viva  está conformado por tres microempresarias emprendedoras de éxito coordinado por Zoila de 40 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo quien es su mayor motivación. Ella se dedica a la venta de bisutería desde hace veinte años en uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pulseras, anillos, aretes y cadenas, uno de los lo9gros obtenidos con las ganancias fue la compra de una cama y un televisor, la segunda socia es Marlene de 57 años y Eufenia de 55 años de edad ellas se dedican a la venta de bisutería y adornos.
texts.en: The communal banking group Ríos de Agua Viva is made up of three enterprising, successful small businesswomen, coordinated by Zoila, 40 years old, single mother of a son who is her greatest motivation. She has been selling costume jewelry for twenty years in one of the city’s main marketplaces. She is requesting a loan to buy bracelets, rings, earrings and necklaces. One of the achievements obtained from her profits was the purchase of a bed and television set. The second member is Marlene, 57, and Eufenia, 55; they sell costume jewelry and ornaments.

loans.use: buy bracelets, rings, earrings and necklaces.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 34 years old, and a hardworking woman with five children. She has been providing stitching services in her community. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. 

When Kousar started working, she brought her family out of a financial crisis that they were facing. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Kousar requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and laces to meet the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for her family's prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and laces to meet the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana is a 23-year-old married woman who is the mother of 2 children. She is working hard to meet their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. With her husband, she has been doing agricultural work for some years. They raise different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, Ramzana has applied a loan of 40000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is 52 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to support her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she expects to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mosam

texts.en:
Mosab is a 23-year-old single young man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. His father is a construction worker where he earns a low and unstable income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs.

Mosab is a student in the university where he studies civil engineering. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family with part of their expenses.

Mosab took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installment for the coming semester. By taking this loan, Mosab will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.
Mosab appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installment for the coming semester.

loans.name: Trinidad De La Concecion

texts.es:
Doña Trinidad es una mujer, muy esforzada, que ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante, por medio de su negocio, de venta de refrescos naturales de forma ambulante. Todos los días inicia su jornada laboral a las cuatro de la mañana, lavando y pelando las frutas que utilizara para hacer el refresco. Con mucha dedicación, a la mitad del día sale a ofrecer su producto. 
En estos momentos los clientes presentan mayor demanda de refrescos, es por eso que ha recurrido a un prestamo que utilizara para comprar grandes cantidades de frutas, dado que si compra más le sale más barato y produce más, incrementando sus ganancias. En un futuro desea poner un cafetín en su casa de habitación para no tener que vender de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a hardworking woman who has managed to support her family through her business. She sells natural soft drinks on the streets. She begins working at four in the morning every day. She washes and peels the fruit that she uses to make the soft drinks. By the middle of the day she is ready to go out to sell her product. 

There is currently greater demand for soft drinks; for this reason, she has requested a loan, which she will use to buy greater quantities of fruit. If she buys more, it will be cheaper and she can produce more, thereby increasing her profits. In the future, she wants to have a small café in her house so she doesn’t have to sell her products on the streets.

loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk

loans.name: Memona

texts.en:
Memona is a 51-year-old woman who has a business purchasing and selling animals. She is a mother of two children and her business has provided her family with a decent life. Memona is very motivated to provide her family a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

Memona requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 46-year-old married woman and is the mother of three children. She has been engaged in the business of purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.

She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to serve more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to serve more customers.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 43-year-old married woman. She is involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Naheed has requested a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to buy greater a variety of cloth in different colors to boost her business and her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors to boost her business and her earnings.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.en:
Safargul is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1984. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a contract worker in Russia. She is a tailor; for about ten years she has been sewing traditional women's dresses. She has permanent customers each week. She has some problems with her health.

Each month her husband sends money, but it is not enough to pay for her medical services and medicines. She has appealed to IMON to get a loan to be treated at a hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits KIVA lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie, a fifty-five year old farmer from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, has been in the agriculture business for eight years. Indeed, Charlie is a Jack-of-all-trades. At times he is a tricycle driver, and if anyone is in need of his hand tractor, he is the one to operate it. As a farmer, he always hopes to have a bountiful harvest. However, pestilence, typhoons and other natural calamities always are the big challenges. When Typhoon Yolanda hit the Philippines in 2013, Charlie’s farm was seriously affected. The typhoon wiped all his rice and other crops causing great loss. That did not stop him from continuing his business. With his deep faith and with a lot of hard work and determination, God is continuously blessing his business. In fact, this year he is able to generate a monthly gross sales of Php 465,000.00 from his agricultural products alone.

To continuously sustain the operation of his business, Charlie would like to apply for a Php 45,000.00 loan. He will use this amount to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. He is very positive that this year will give him a great harvest yield.

Charlie meets with his co-fellowship members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. All CCT Community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to ensure a greener harvest.

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
This group is starting their fourth cycle with God is Great as part of the Chorkor branch loan system. It is made up of two members represented by Dora. The businesses of the members are salt, phone cards, and candies.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit all of these micro-entrepreneurs, Dora amongst them. She says that she joined ID-Ghana two years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling salt. She indicated that she learned this business on her own a number of years ago.

The loan that she is receiving will be used to increase her working capital (buying salt at wholesale) that she will acquire at wholesalers in the city of Accra and later sell in a kiosk at her residence. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support herself because she lives alone. She is 60 years old. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she replied that she likes the training and the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy salt from wholesalers and sell it to customers.

loans.name: Munzooran

texts.en:
Munzooran is a 64-year-old married woman with 2 children; one of her sons is also shown in the photo. Her son has been providing the service of flour grinding in his community to contribute in the family income. Now he has become famous for providing fine quality flour and earns good amount of income.

In order to purchase a new grinding machine she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000. It would help her son to serve more customers repeatedly which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine

loans.name: Aryanto

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Aryanto, one of Ruma's agents who lives in Bekasi, the satellite city located at the east of Jakarta. Aryanto is a young guy who has a big spirit: he wants to become an entrepreneur. His main source of income comes from the small stall he manages daily that sells consumer products and mobile phone airtime credits.

It was Ruma's field staff who introduced him to Ruma. He decided to join Ruma by selling mobile phone airtime credits to his surrounding community; he has good track record as a mobile phone airtime provider since his customers are people in the peri-urban area who are in need of access to such services.

As the business continues, Aryanto hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime credits, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Aryanto plans to add more products from Ruma to what he already provides, such as e-commerce for low-income communities called Mapan.

Aryanto is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has had an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007. He is the father of three sons and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income.

Mohammad also has a grocery store where he sells basic grocery products. Mohammad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store. With this loan, Mohammad can buy more goods for his store to resell. Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spices, pork, vegetables, food (rice) and feed.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 24-year-old divorced woman from a village near Nablus city. She lives with her two kids in a simple house. 

Malak has a sewing workshop which has been open for the past two years. This is the only source of income for her family. She would like to improve her business and expand it, so she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy new sewing machines for her business. This will increase her income and also her family's living conditions. Malak appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines for her business.

loans.name: Rosendita

texts.en:
Growing and selling vegetables is not an easy business since you need to work daily with no weekends off: you need to wake up early and deal with nature every time. Changes of weather like drought and storms, as well as bugs and insects, can take out much of what might be sold. Plus, the price of fertilizers is high. These are some of the reasons that the agricultural business is challenging.

One of the CCT partners, Rosendita, has been engaged with this kind of business for 43 years already; she is the wife of Nilo from San Miguel Barotac Viejo Iloilo. All of the hard work and effort seem like nothing every time they see their vegetables grow and be sold in the market. She decided to apply for P10,000 loan to have additional capital to buy fertilizer and pesticides so that they will be able to produce a large quantity of fresh vegetables and get rid of pests and insects.

Rosendita regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience of the business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides so that they will be able to produce a large quantity of fresh vegetables and get rid of pests and insects.

loans.name: Listari

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Listari, one of Ruma's agents who lives in Bekasi, the satellite city located at the east of Jakarta. Listari is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with two cute daughters. Her main source of income comes from the small stall she manages that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. It was Ruma field staff who introduced her to Ruma. She decided to join Ruma by selling mobile phone airtime credits to her surrounding community. Listari has a good track record as an agent now since her customers are people in a peri-urban area who are in need of access to such services.

As her business continues, Listari hopes to get a loan from Kiva that will be used to process more of mobile airtime, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Listaro plans to add more products from Ruma to what she already sells, such as e-commerce for low-income communities.

Listari is the one who is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single young man from Rafah city. His brother is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Mohammad is a university student studying elementary education. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family with part of their expenses.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and reports easily. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Luis Moises

texts.es: Luis de 47 años,  reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y diariamente en su tienda de víveres ofrece una gran variedad de productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar y son de primera necesidad para los hogares.  Luis recuerda que su idea de negocio surgió al encontrarse sin empleo y decidió utilizar su liquidación para iniciar su tienda de víveres, pero que sin la ayuda de su cónyuge no hubiese sido posible tener éxito en su negocio, pues ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad.  Hoy en día cuenta con 15 años de experiencia y un posicionamiento en el sector que le exige tener un mayor surtido en su negocio para poder responder a la creciente demanda, por eso está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en arroz, verduras y carnes.  Su meta a futuro es realizarle unas adecuaciones a su local y continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: Luis, 47, lives with his spouse in a neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, and daily in his grocery store he offers a large variety of products that are part of family staples and basic household necessities. Luis recalls that his business idea emerged when he found himself unemployed and he decided to use his severance pay to start his grocery store, but without the help of his spouse it would not have been possible to succeed in his business, because she has a lot of experience in this trade. Today he has 15 years of experience and a position in the industry that requires him to have a wider assortment in his business in order to be able to meet growing demand. For this reason he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which he will invest in rice, vegetables and meats. His goal for the future is to make some improvements to his business place and to continue providing for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: invest in rice, vegetables and meats.

loans.name: Dora Elena

texts.es: Dora tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera habita en casa de su propiedad a lado de sus dos hijos mayores de edad y sus dos nietos. Dora es una mujer dedicada a su familia a quienes apoyada en su trabajo ha sabido sacar adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de elote lo cual es su principal actividad y además también elabora antojitos típicos como son: pastelitos de carne con verduras, yuca y papas fritas dos veces por semana, es así como se gana la vida y gracias a su amabilidad y excelente calidad de sus productos  a logrado crear un buen número de clientes. Por lo anterior y con el deseo de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio Dora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para compra de materia prima como: aceite de cocina, margarina, especias, bolsas plásticas, elotes, yuca, etc. Para así poder aumentar la producción de sus ventas las cuales le generen mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Dora is 54 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own home together with her two grown children and her two grandchildren. Dora is a woman who is dedicated to her family, and she has known how to get them ahead through her work.

She works selling corn tamales, which is her main business. She also makes traditional snacks such as: meat and vegetable pies, yucca, and fries twice a week. That is how she makes a living and thanks to her kindness and the excellent quality of her products, she has created a good number of customers.

For the aforementioned, and with the desire to continue investing in her business, Dora has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI to buy raw materials such as: cooking oil, margarine, spices, plastic bags, corn, yucca, etc. in order to expand her production and sales, which will generate better income.

loans.use: to buy: cooking oil, margarine, spices, plastic bags, corn, yucca, etc. in order to expand her production and sales.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 40-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals to help her husband in meeting their household activities. 

Safia has a good client list. Now, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Manar

texts.en:
Manar is a 20-year-old single young woman from Gaza city. Her father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Manar is a student in the university where she studies Information Technology. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses.

Manar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay her university fee installment for the coming semester. By taking this loan, Manar will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Manar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her university fee installment for the coming semester.

loans.name: Phyles

texts.en:
Phyles is 22 years old and she has one child. She has done tea farming for the last five years and the business has been profitable.

She will use the loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production to sell milk to her customers so as to make more income and be able to support her family and also expand her farming.

She plans to use the generated profits to educate her children, buy farm inputs and repay the loan. Her future hopes and dreams are to be successful in her farming and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production to sell milk to her customers so as to make more income and be able to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials for doors and windows.

loans.name: Katindo Kaseo Dip W.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Margaret, 52 years old, married and blessed with four children, two of whom are schooling. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development.

She practices poultry farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chicken, hence increasing her poultry production. This will ensure she meets the growing demand for eggs and chicken in the market and thus earn more income to pay for family needs such as food, school fees and clothing.

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to increase poultry production for more income to pay for family expenses such as food, clothing and school fees.

loans.name: Oscar David

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre de 29 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el transporte. 
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Sacaba’ área privilegiada por el encanto natural del valle, goza de características únicas que cautivan por su clima y atractivos turísticos. Situado a13 kilómetros de la ciudad, a una altura que varía entre los 2600 y 4500 metros sobre el nivel del mar. De clima templado durante todo el año con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 15-28 grados centígrados.
Oscar es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la realiza solo, vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no cuenta con alcantarillado. Él se dedica a transportar frutas y verduras del campo a la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana durante horas del día. La zona dónde vive nunca contó con agua potable por ser un área alejada y rural, hace un tiempo atrás el gobierno nacional decidió llevar las conexiones de agua potable hasta el lugar, “el agua de pozo es sucia y no es buena para el consumo, también usamos agua de rio para lavar nuestras ropas…” comenta. La ventaja de su zona es que ya cuenta con agua potable, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería. Su sueño es contar con agua potable en su domicilio, el desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para cumplir su sueño de usar agua potable. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que construye su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Oscar solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para la buena salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 29 year old man, single, without children and his business is transportation. He is entrepreneurial, independent, steadfast, patient, responsible and hard working. He does his work in the ‘Sacaba’ location. This area is preferred for its charming natural valley’s. It boasts mesmerizing and unique characteristics like its climate and tourist attractions. 

It is located 13 kilometers from the city at an altitude that varies between 2600 and 4500 meters above sea level. It has a temperate climate year round with daytime temperatures varying between 15-28 degrees centigrade.

Oscar is dark skinned and short with brown eyes, short black hair and a thin physique. His mother tongue is Quechua which he speaks in his area and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and the work he does. He lives his life alone. He lives in his own home built from bricks and cement with a corrugated iron roof and dirt floors. It has electricity and well water, extracted using a pump. It does not have a sewage system. 

He works transporting fruit and vegetables from the countryside to the city. He does this work every day of the week during daytime hours. The area where he lives never had potable water because it is a remote and rural area. A while ago, the national government decided to bring the potable water connections to this place. He says: “Well water is dirty and not fit for consumption. We also use river water to wash our clothing.” 

The advantage of this area is that it already has potable water. The disadvantage is the lack of capital for installing potable water in his kitchen, bathroom and wash room. His dream is to have potable water in his home. He wishes to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom and wash room to fulfill his dream of using potable water. This is his 1st loan sequence with the institution in the 6 years he has been building his home.

It is for these reasons that Oscar requests a loan to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom and wash room for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom and wash room for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.name: Ziyoratsho

texts.en: Ziyoratsho is a hardworking man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1952. He is living alone in his village. He is divorced and has no children. He is a teacher at a medical college, and is well known among friends and tutors. He is old and unwell. He wants to recover and be healthy so he can continue teaching. He appealed to IMON asking for financial support for treatment at the medical clinic. He wishes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to be treated at a medical clinic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy corn, plastic bags, lime, pay to have the corn milled, etc. for making corn tortillas.

loans.name: Nur

texts.en: Hello, lenders! Meet Nur, one of Ruma's agents who lives in Bekasi, the satellite city located in the east of Jakarta. Nur is happily married. Her main source of income comes from the small stall she manages that sells snacks, drinks, some daily consumer products, and mobile phone airtime credits. It was Ruma field staff who introduced her to Ruma. She decided to join Ruma by selling mobile phone airtime credits to her surrounding community. Nur has a good track record as an agent now since her customers are people in a semi-urban area who are in need of access to such services. As the business runs, Nur hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime, especially on the weekends. In the near future, she plans to add more products from Ruma to the services she provides, such as e-commerce for low income communities, Ruma's latest product, called Mapan. Nur is the one who is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 31 ans habitant à Tokoin. Akossiwa a deux enfants à charge. Akossiwa est une commerçante de friperies. Akossiwa achète ses marchandises  au marché et les revendent de quartier en quartier. Akossiwa s’approvisionne une fois dans le mois. Akossiwa désire ce prêt pour faire l’achat de friperies. Avec le bénéfice résultant, Akossiwa réalisera son objectif.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 31-year-old married woman living in Tokoin. She has two children and is a merchant of used clothing.

Akossiwa buys her merchandise once a month at the market and resells from neighborhood to neighborhood.

Akossiwa wants this loan to buy used clothing. With the resulting profits, she will be able to meet her objectives.

loans.use: buy 20 dozen clothes

loans.name: Jose Alcides

texts.es: Don Jose de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 51 years of age and lives in his own home with his wife. He makes a living selling clothing, travelling to different markets close to his home. He has many loyal customers because of the quality of his clothing and his good prices. With what he earns he manages to cover some of the household expenses. 

The client is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing wholesale so that he can continue with his sale and in this way improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets (swine), feeds and food (rice)

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr: Veuve de trois enfants, Lucie est une femme âgée de 58 ans habitant à Tokoin. Lucie est une revendeuse de fruits et de spirale anti- moustique. Lucie  achète ses marchandises au marché deux fois par mois. Lucie sollicite ce prêt pour commander des fruits et des spirales anti- moustique. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Lucie compte soutenir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 58-year-old widow with three children living in Tokoin. She is a retailer of fruits and mosquito repellents.

Lucie buys her goods twice a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to order fruit and mosquito repellents.

With the resulting profit margins, Lucie expects she can support the daily family expenditures.

loans.use: Buy three bags of oranges, two baskets of bananas and two boxes of mosquito repellents

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Everything he does is because of a dream: to bridge his children into finishing their studies and make his business grow. 

This is Jerry, 33, a resident of Intramuros City. Married with Jane, they both ensure the lives of their two kids who are still both young today, with the eldest in elementary school. 

Jerry supplies inks for computer use and at the same time sells office supplies as a way to earn money. 

To further improve the business, he wants to ask for a 10,000 PHP loan which he will use for buying more office supplies like papers, pens and inks as well. With this, he can surely gain more income and profit. Part of what he will gain, he will save for future investments, and part will be used for their everyday living. 
 
You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. 

Jerry meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more office supplies like papers, pens and inksl for his inventory.
